original: ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig pa'i srid pa de dang de la mngon par dga' ba ma lus pa spangs shing nges par 'byung ba zad pa 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa nye bar zhi ba grub pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig pa'i srid pa de dang de la mngon par dga' ba ma lus pa spangs shing nges par 'byung ba zad pa 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa nye bar zhi ba grub pa'o //
translated: It is the complete abandonment of, thorough relinquishment of, termination of, non-connection with, pacification of, and non-apprehension of that craving which is accompanied by the delight of sensual pleasure and which delights in this and that.

original: 'phags ma ji ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags ma ji ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “Noble lady, how does the view of the transitory collection arise?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa gzugs bdag yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //🔽gzugs bdag dang ldan /🔽bdag la gzugs yod /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa gzugs bdag yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo // gzugs bdag dang ldan / bdag la gzugs yod /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, a foolish, ordinary person, untrained in the Dharma, sees form as the self.🔽He sees the self as possessing form.🔽He sees form in the self.

original: gzugs la bdag gnas zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing /
analyzed: gzugs la bdag gnas zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing /
translated: He sees the self in form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang ; 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag yin rnam par shes pa bdag dang ldan /🔽bdag la rnam par shes pa yod /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang ; 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag yin rnam par shes pa bdag dang ldan / bdag la rnam par shes pa yod /
translated: Similarly, he sees feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness as the self. He sees the self as possessing consciousness.🔽He sees consciousness in the self.

original: rnam par shes pa la bdag gnas zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la bdag gnas zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong ste /
translated: He sees the self in consciousness.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba kun 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba kun 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The origin of the view of the transitory collection will occur.

original: 'phags ma ji ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags ma ji ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Noble lady, how will the origin of the view of the transitory collection not occur?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pas gzugs bdag yin /🔽gzugs bdag dang ldan /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pas gzugs bdag yin / gzugs bdag dang ldan /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, a noble disciple who possesses learning does not see form as the self,🔽as possessing the self,

original: bdag la gzugs yod /
analyzed: bdag la gzugs yod /
translated: as the self being in the form,

original: gzugs la bdag gnas zhes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: gzugs la bdag gnas zhes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: or as the form being in the self.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag yin /🔽rnam par shes pa bdag dang ldan /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag yin / rnam par shes pa bdag dang ldan /
translated: He does not see feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness as the self,🔽as possessing the self,

original: bdag la rnam par shes pa yod /
analyzed: bdag la rnam par shes pa yod /
translated: as the self being in consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa la bdag gnas zhes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la bdag gnas zhes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: or as consciousness being in the self.

original: des na 'jig tshogs la lta ba kun 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'jig tshogs la lta ba kun 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the origin of the view of the transitory collection will not occur.

original: 'phags ma phung po dang nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes brjod pa /
analyzed: 'phags ma phung po dang nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes brjod pa /
translated: Noble lady, it is said that there are the aggregates and the appropriated aggregates.

original: 'phags ma ci phung po gang yin pa de nyid nye bar len pa'i phung po yin nam /
analyzed: 'phags ma ci phung po gang yin pa de nyid nye bar len pa'i phung po yin nam /
translated: Noble lady, is the same thing that is an aggregate also an appropriated aggregate?

original: 'on te phung po gzhan nyid yin cing nye bar len pa'i phung po yang gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on te phung po gzhan nyid yin cing nye bar len pa'i phung po yang gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: Or is an aggregate something different from an appropriated aggregate?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga nye bar len pa'i phung po gang yin pa ni phung po yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga nye bar len pa'i phung po gang yin pa ni phung po yin no //
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, that which is an appropriated aggregate is an aggregate.

original: phung po ni nye bar len pa'i phung po ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po ni nye bar len pa'i phung po ma yin no //
translated: An aggregate is not an appropriated aggregate.

original: phung po ni nye bar len pa'i phung po yin pa ni gang /
analyzed: phung po ni nye bar len pa'i phung po yin pa ni gang /
translated: What is an aggregate that is an appropriated aggregate?

original: phung po yin la nye bar len pa'i phung po ma yin pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: phung po yin la nye bar len pa'i phung po ma yin pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is an aggregate that is not an appropriated aggregate?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa @7b ga gzugs gang zag pa dang bcas pa nye bar len pa dang bcas pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa gang zag pa dang bcas pa nye bar len pa dang bcas pa 'di phung po yang yin la nye bar len pa'i phung po yang yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa @7b ga gzugs gang zag pa dang bcas pa nye bar len pa dang bcas pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa gang zag pa dang bcas pa nye bar len pa dang bcas pa 'di phung po yang yin la nye bar len pa'i phung po yang yin no //
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, form that is subject to impurity and subject to appropriation, feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness that are subject to impurity and subject to appropriation are aggregates and also appropriated aggregates.

original: gzugs gang zag pa med cing nye bar len pa med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zag pa med cing nye bar len pa med pa 'di ni phung po yin la nye bar len pa'i phung po ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs gang zag pa med cing nye bar len pa med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zag pa med cing nye bar len pa med pa 'di ni phung po yin la nye bar len pa'i phung po ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Form that is not subject to affliction and not subject to appropriation, and feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness that are not subject to affliction and not subject to appropriation are called the aggregates, but not the appropriated aggregates.🔽“Noble lady, it is said that the three aggregates are the aggregate of morality, the aggregate of concentration, and the aggregate of wisdom, and that there is also the noble eightfold path. Are the three aggregates included in the noble eightfold path,

original: 'phags ma gang 'di phung po gsum po tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / gang yang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes 'byung ba ci phung po gsum gyis 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad bsdus sam /
analyzed: 'phags ma gang 'di phung po gsum po tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / gang yang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes 'byung ba ci phung po gsum gyis 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad bsdus sam /
translated: or are the three aggregates included in the noble eightfold path?”🔽The venerable Saṅgharakṣita said, “The three aggregates are included in the noble eightfold path,

original: 'on te 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyis phung po gsum bsdus /🔽tshe dang ldan pa sa ga phung po gsum gyis 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad bsdus kyi /
analyzed: 'on te 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyis phung po gsum bsdus /🔽tshe dang ldan pa sa ga phung po gsum gyis 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad bsdus kyi /
translated: but the noble eightfold path is not included in the three aggregates.”

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyis ni phung po gsum bsdus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyis ni phung po gsum bsdus pa ma yin no //
translated: The eightfold noble path does not include the three aggregates.

original: ji ltar phung po gsum gyis 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad bsdus shing 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyis phung po gsum ma bsdus she na /
analyzed: ji ltar phung po gsum gyis 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad bsdus shing 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyis phung po gsum ma bsdus she na /
translated: How is it that the three aggregates include the eightfold noble path, and the eightfold noble path does not include the three aggregates?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga de la yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis tshul khrims kyi phung por bshad do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga de la yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis tshul khrims kyi phung por bshad do //
translated: Venerable Saṃghabhadra, the Blessed One explained right speech, right action, and right livelihood as the aggregate of morality.

original: gang yang yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi phung por bshad do //
analyzed: gang yang yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi phung por bshad do //
translated: The Blessed One explained right mindfulness and right concentration as the aggregate of concentration.

original: gang yang yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi phung por bshad do //
analyzed: gang yang yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi phung por bshad do //
translated: The Blessed One explained right view, right thought, and right effort as the aggregate of wisdom.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga des na phung po gsum gyis 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad bsdus shing 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyis ni phung po gsum ma lus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga des na phung po gsum gyis 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad bsdus shing 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyis ni phung po gsum ma lus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Venerable Vatsagotra, therefore, the three aggregates are included in the eightfold noble path, and the eightfold noble path is completely included in the three aggregates.

original: 'phags ma lam 'dus byas sam 'on te 'dus ma byas pa /
analyzed: 'phags ma lam 'dus byas sam 'on te 'dus ma byas pa /
translated: Noble lady, is the noble path conditioned or unconditioned?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga @8a * //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga @8a * //
translated: Venerable Vatsagotra,

original: 'dus byas so //
analyzed: 'dus byas so //
translated: it is conditioned.

original: 'phags ma 'gog pa 'dra ba yin nam /
analyzed: 'phags ma 'gog pa 'dra ba yin nam /
translated: Noble lady, is it similar to cessation?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga 'dra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga 'dra ba ma yin no //
translated: Venerable Vatsagotra, it is not similar.

original: 'phags ma bsam gtan dang po yan lag du zhig dang ldan /
analyzed: 'phags ma bsam gtan dang po yan lag du zhig dang ldan /
translated: Noble lady, how many factors does the first concentration possess?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga yan lag lnga dang ldan te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga yan lag lnga dang ldan te /
translated: Venerable Vatsagotra, it possesses five factors:

original: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: investigation, analysis, joy, bliss, and unification of mind.

original: 'phags ma ting nge 'dzin dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu mtshan dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgom pa zhes 'byung ba /
analyzed: 'phags ma ting nge 'dzin dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu mtshan dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgom pa zhes 'byung ba /
translated: Noble lady, it is said that there is concentration, the sign of concentration, the power of concentration, and the cultivation of concentration.

original: 'phags ma ting nge 'dzin ni gang /
analyzed: 'phags ma ting nge 'dzin ni gang /
translated: Noble lady, what is concentration?

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu mtshan dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin sgom pa ni gang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu mtshan dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin sgom pa ni gang /
translated: What is the basis of concentration? What is the power of concentration? What is the cultivation of concentration?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa ni ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa ni ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: Venerable Saṅgharakṣita, one-pointedness of mind is concentration.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu mtshan no //
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness are the basis of concentration.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs so //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs so //
translated: The four right efforts are the power of concentration.

original: chos 'di rnams nyid la bsnyen par byed /
analyzed: chos 'di rnams nyid la bsnyen par byed /
translated: One should approach these teachings,

original: nye bar bsnyen par byed /
analyzed: nye bar bsnyen par byed /
translated: one should approach them closely,

original: gnas par byed /
analyzed: gnas par byed /
translated: one should abide in them,

original: bsgom zhing sbyor ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom zhing sbyor ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and one should cultivate and practice them. This is called the cultivation of concentration.

original: 'phags ma 'du byed 'du byed ces 'byung ba /
analyzed: 'phags ma 'du byed 'du byed ces 'byung ba /
translated: Noble lady, it is said, “formations, formations.”

original: 'phags ma 'du byed rnams gang /
analyzed: 'phags ma 'du byed rnams gang /
translated: Noble lady, what are formations?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga lus kyi 'du byed dang / ngag gi 'du byed dang / yid kyi 'du byed dang gsum mo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga lus kyi 'du byed dang / ngag gi 'du byed dang / yid kyi 'du byed dang gsum mo //
translated: Venerable Saṅgharakṣita, there are three: bodily formations, verbal formations, and mental formations.

original: 'phags ma lus kyi 'du byed gang /
analyzed: 'phags ma lus kyi 'du byed gang /
translated: Noble lady, what are bodily formations?

original: ngag gi 'du byed gang /
analyzed: ngag gi 'du byed gang /
translated: What are the volitions of speech?

original: yid kyi 'du byed gang /
analyzed: yid kyi 'du byed gang /
translated: What are the volitions of mind?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa ni lus kyi 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa ni lus kyi 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: Venerable Saṅgharakṣita, inhalation and exhalation are called the volitions of the body.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa ni ngag gi 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa ni ngag gi 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: Discursive thought and analysis are called the volitions of speech.

original: 'du shes dang sems pa ni yid kyi 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes dang sems pa ni yid kyi 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: Perception and intention are called the volitions of mind.

original: 'phags ma dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa ci'i phyir lus kyi 'du byed ces bya /
analyzed: 'phags ma dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa ci'i phyir lus kyi 'du byed ces bya /
translated: Noble lady, why are inhalation and exhalation called the volitions of the body?

original: 'phags ma rtog pa dang dpyod pa ci'i phyir ngag gi 'du byed ces bya /
analyzed: 'phags ma rtog pa dang dpyod pa ci'i phyir ngag gi 'du byed ces bya /
translated: Noble lady, why are discursive thought and analysis called the volitions of speech?

original: 'du shes dang sems pa ci'i phyir yid kyi 'du byed ces bya /
analyzed: 'du shes dang sems pa ci'i phyir yid kyi 'du byed ces bya /
translated: Why are perception and intention called the volitions of mind?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa ni lus kyi chos te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa ni lus kyi chos te /
translated: Venerable Saṅgharakṣita, inhalation and exhalation are the phenomena of the body.

original: lus la brten pa lus dang 'brel ba lus la brten te rab tu 'jug pas de'i phyir dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa lus kyi 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: lus la brten pa lus dang 'brel ba lus la brten te rab tu 'jug pas de'i phyir dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa lus kyi 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: Because they depend on the body, are related to the body, and operate in dependence on the body, therefore inhalation and exhalation are called the volitions of the body.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pas ni brtags shing dpyad nas smra ba de'i phyir rtog pa dang dpyod pa la ngag gi 'du byed ces @8b bya'o ;
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pas ni brtags shing dpyad nas smra ba de'i phyir rtog pa dang dpyod pa la ngag gi 'du byed ces @8b bya'o ;
translated: Because it speaks after investigating and analyzing with investigation and analysis, therefore investigation and analysis are called the formative factors of speech.

original: /'du shes dang sems pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos te /
analyzed: /'du shes dang sems pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos te /
translated: Discernment and intention are mental factors.

original: sems kyi rjes su 'gro ba sems la brten pa sems dang 'brel pa sems la rab tu brten nas 'jug pas de'i phyir 'du shes dang sems pa la yid kyi 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'gro ba sems la brten pa sems dang 'brel pa sems la rab tu brten nas 'jug pas de'i phyir 'du shes dang sems pa la yid kyi 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: Because they occur in dependence on the mind, they are based on the mind, they are connected to the mind, and they are fully dependent on the mind, therefore discernment and intention are called the formative factors of the mind.

original: 'phags ma gang gi tshe chos des lus bor nas sems med pa'i shing bzhin du gnas pa de'i tshe lus btang nas gnas par 'gyur ba'i chos de gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags ma gang gi tshe chos des lus bor nas sems med pa'i shing bzhin du gnas pa de'i tshe lus btang nas gnas par 'gyur ba'i chos de gang zhe na /
translated: “Noble lady, when the body is abandoned through that Dharma, and one remains like a mindless log, what is that Dharma through which one remains after abandoning the body?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga tshe dang drod dang rnam par shes pa gsum gyis te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga tshe dang drod dang rnam par shes pa gsum gyis te /
translated: “Venerable Pūrṇa, it is through three things: life, heat, and consciousness.

original: tshe dang drod dang rnam shes kyis //
analyzed: tshe dang drod dang rnam shes kyis //
translated: Life, heat, and consciousness,🔽when they abandon the body,

original: gang tshe lus ni 'dor byed cing //
analyzed: gang tshe lus ni 'dor byed cing //
translated: then,🔽like a mindless log,

original: bor nas de tshe gnas pa ni //🔽sems med ci ltar shing bzhin no //
analyzed: bor nas de tshe gnas pa ni //🔽sems med ci ltar shing bzhin no //
translated: one remains after abandoning it.”

original: 'phags ma shi zhing dus las 'das pa dang 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa bsam pa'am rgyu tha dad pa'am /🔽khyad par 'ga' zhig yod dam /
analyzed: 'phags ma shi zhing dus las 'das pa dang 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa bsam pa'am rgyu tha dad pa'am / khyad par 'ga' zhig yod dam /
translated: Is there any difference between the noble one who has died and passed away and the one who has entered the absorption of cessation?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga shi zhing dus las 'das pa dang 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa bsam pa'am rgyu tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga shi zhing dus las 'das pa dang 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa bsam pa'am rgyu tha dad pa'am /
translated: Venerable Saṅgharakṣita, is there any difference between the one who has died and passed away and the one who has entered the absorption of cessation?

original: khyad par rnam pa mang du yod de /
analyzed: khyad par rnam pa mang du yod de /
translated: There are many differences.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga shi zhing dus las 'das pa ni lus kyi 'du byed 'gags shing sems kyi 'du byed dang ngag gi 'du byed 'gags par 'gyur la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga shi zhing dus las 'das pa ni lus kyi 'du byed 'gags shing sems kyi 'du byed dang ngag gi 'du byed 'gags par 'gyur la /
translated: Venerable Saṅgharakṣita, when one has died and passed away, the formative factors of the body cease, and the formative factors of the mind and speech cease.

original: tshe dang drod dang bral zhing dbang po rnams gzhan du gyur cing rnam par shes pa lus las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe dang drod dang bral zhing dbang po rnams gzhan du gyur cing rnam par shes pa lus las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One is separated from life and heat, the faculties change, and consciousness departs from the body.

original: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa ni lus kyi 'du byed 'gag par 'gyur zhing ngag gi 'du byed dang sems kyi 'du byed 'gag par 'gyur yang tshe dang drod 'gag par mi 'gyur zhing dbang po gzhan du 'gyur ba dang ; rnam par shes pa lus las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa ni lus kyi 'du byed 'gag par 'gyur zhing ngag gi 'du byed dang sems kyi 'du byed 'gag par 'gyur yang tshe dang drod 'gag par mi 'gyur zhing dbang po gzhan du 'gyur ba dang ; rnam par shes pa lus las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When one enters meditative attainment in cessation, the formative forces of the body cease, the formative forces of speech cease, and the formative forces of mind cease, but life does not cease, heat does not cease, the other faculties do not change, and consciousness does not depart from the body.

original: gang tshe dang ldan pa sa ga shi zhing dus las 'das pa dang 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa 'di'i bsam pa dang rgyu dang khyad par yin no //
analyzed: gang tshe dang ldan pa sa ga shi zhing dus las 'das pa dang 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa 'di'i bsam pa dang rgyu dang khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the intention, the cause and the distinction of the venerable Saṅgharakṣita who, having died and passed away, entered meditative attainment in cessation.

original: 'phags ma ji ltar 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'phags ma ji ltar 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: Noble lady, how does one enter meditative attainment in cessation?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga dge slong 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa na bdag 'di ltar 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la zhugs par bya'o snyam du mi sems /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga dge slong 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa na bdag 'di ltar 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la zhugs par bya'o snyam du mi sems /
translated: Venerable Saṅgharakṣita, when a monk enters meditative attainment in cessation, he does not think, “I will enter this meditative attainment in cessation.”

original: 'di'i sems sngon de lta de ltar yongs su sbyang zhing yongs su sbyang ba byas pa ji lta ji ltar de dang de la nye bar gnas par @9a * //
analyzed: 'di'i sems sngon de lta de ltar yongs su sbyang zhing yongs su sbyang ba byas pa ji lta ji ltar de dang de la nye bar gnas par @9a * //
translated: As the mind has been thoroughly refined and purified in this way, it will remain in this state.

original: 'gyur ro // 'phags ma ji ltar 'gog pa las ldang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // 'phags ma ji ltar 'gog pa las ldang bar 'gyur /
translated: “Noble lady, how does one arise from the cessation?”🔽“Venerable Pūrṇa, when a monk who is abiding in cessation arises, he does not think, ‘I will arise from cessation and arise.’

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga dge slong 'gog pa la gnas pa ldang ba na 'di ltar bdag 'gog pa las langs shing ldang bar bya'o snyam du mi sems kyang 'di sems sngon nyid du de lta de ltar yongs su sbyangs shing yongs su sbyang ba byas pa
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga dge slong 'gog pa la gnas pa ldang ba na 'di ltar bdag 'gog pa las langs shing ldang bar bya'o snyam du mi sems kyang 'di sems sngon nyid du de lta de ltar yongs su sbyangs shing yongs su sbyang ba byas pa
translated: However, as the mind has been thoroughly refined and purified in this way,

original: ji lta ji ltar de dang de la nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar de dang de la nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: it will remain in this state.

original: 'phags ma dge slong 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa ni lus kyi 'du byed dam /🔽ngag gi 'du byed dam /
analyzed: 'phags ma dge slong 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa ni lus kyi 'du byed dam / ngag gi 'du byed dam /
translated: “Noble lady, when a monk enters the absorption of cessation, how many physical,

original: sems kyi 'du byed kyi chos du zhig dang po nyid du 'gag par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems kyi 'du byed kyi chos du zhig dang po nyid du 'gag par 'gyur /
translated: verbal, and mental formations cease first?”🔽“Venerable Pūrṇa, when a monk enters the absorption of cessation, all physical formations cease first.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga dge slong 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang po nyid du ngag gi 'du byed 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga dge slong 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang po nyid du ngag gi 'du byed 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Venerable Saṅgharakṣita, when a monk enters the absorption of cessation, first the verbal formations cease.

original: de nas ni lus dang yid kyi 'du byed do //
analyzed: de nas ni lus dang yid kyi 'du byed do //
translated: After that, the bodily and mental formations cease.

original: 'phags ma dge slong 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa las langs pa na dang po nyid du lus kyi 'du byed dam /
analyzed: 'phags ma dge slong 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa las langs pa na dang po nyid du lus kyi 'du byed dam /
translated: Noble lady, when a monk who has entered the absorption of cessation arises, how many of the bodily formations,

original: ngag gi 'du byed dang ; yid kyi 'du byed kyi chos du zhig skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ngag gi 'du byed dang ; yid kyi 'du byed kyi chos du zhig skye bar 'gyur /
translated: verbal formations, and mental formations arise first?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga dge slong 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa la langs pa na dang po nyid du yid kyi 'du byed skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga dge slong 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa la langs pa na dang po nyid du yid kyi 'du byed skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Venerable Saṅgharakṣita, when a monk who has entered the absorption of cessation arises, first the mental formations arise.

original: de nas ni lus dang ngag gi 'du byed do //
analyzed: de nas ni lus dang ngag gi 'du byed do //
translated: After that, the bodily and verbal formations arise.

original: 'phags ma dge slong 'gog pa las langs pa sems zhing lag gzhol zhing zhing la 'bab pa dang gang la bab par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'phags ma dge slong 'gog pa las langs pa sems zhing lag gzhol zhing zhing la 'bab pa dang gang la bab par 'gyur /
translated: Noble lady, when a monk who has arisen from the absorption of cessation is thinking, how many of the bodily formations,🔽verbal formations, and mental formations arise, and on what do they arise?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga dge slong 'gog pa las langs pa'i sems dben pa la gzhol ba dang / dben pa las 'bab pa dang / dben pa la bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga dge slong 'gog pa las langs pa'i sems dben pa la gzhol ba dang / dben pa las 'bab pa dang / dben pa la bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: that descends into seclusion, and that is settled in seclusion.

original: thar pa la gzhol zhing thar pa la 'bab pa dang thar pa la bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thar pa la gzhol zhing thar pa la 'bab pa dang thar pa la bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is inclined toward liberation, descends into liberation, and is settled in liberation.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol zhing mya ngan las 'das pa la 'bab pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol zhing mya ngan las 'das pa la 'bab pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is inclined toward nirvāṇa, descends into nirvāṇa, and is settled in nirvāṇa.🔽“Noble lady, when a monk who has arisen from cessation makes contact, what does he make contact with?”

original: 'phags ma dge slong 'gog pa las langs pa reg pa gang la reg / tshe dang ldan pa sa ga mi g-yo ba dang / cung zad med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa gsum la'o /
analyzed: 'phags ma dge slong 'gog pa las langs pa reg pa gang la reg / tshe dang ldan pa sa ga mi g-yo ba dang / cung zad med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa gsum la'o /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, he makes contact with the three: the immovable, the nothingness, and the signless.”

original: 'phags ma dge slong 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa chos mang po du zhig byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'phags ma dge slong 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa chos mang po du zhig byed par 'gyur /
translated: “Noble lady, how many phenomena does a monk who has entered into the absorption of cessation perform?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga dri ba 'di ni thog ma nyid du dri bar bya ba dang da ltar byas kyang lung bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga dri ba 'di ni thog ma nyid du dri bar bya ba dang da ltar byas kyang lung bstan par bya'o //
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, this question should have been asked first, and now that it has been asked, it should be answered.

original: dge slong @9b 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa chos gnyis kyis mang po byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong @9b 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa chos gnyis kyis mang po byed par 'gyur te /
translated: A bhikṣu who has entered the meditative absorption of cessation performs two dharmas:

original: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong ngo //
translated: śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: 'phags ma tshor ba gang /
analyzed: 'phags ma tshor ba gang /
translated: Āryā, what are the feelings?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga gsum ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga gsum ste /
translated: Venerable Saṃghabhadra says there are three:

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: 'phags ma bde ba'i tshor ba ni gang /
analyzed: 'phags ma bde ba'i tshor ba ni gang /
translated: Āryā, what is a pleasant feeling?

original: sdug bsngal ba'i tshor ba ni gang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i tshor ba ni gang /
translated: What is an unpleasant feeling?

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni gang /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni gang /
translated: What is a feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga bde ba'i tshor ba'i reg pa las skyes pa lus dang sems kyis bde ba dang dga' ba myong ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga bde ba'i tshor ba'i reg pa las skyes pa lus dang sems kyis bde ba dang dga' ba myong ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Venerable Saṃghabhadra says: That which arises from contact with a pleasant object, the experience of physical and mental pleasure and joy, is called a pleasant feeling.

original: gang sdug bsngal myong ba'i reg bya reg pa las skyes pa lus dang sems kyis sdug bsngal ba dang mi bde ba tshor zhing rig pa ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal myong ba'i reg bya reg pa las skyes pa lus dang sems kyis sdug bsngal ba dang mi bde ba tshor zhing rig pa ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The contact that produces the sensation of pain, which is felt and perceived as painful and unpleasant by the body and the mind, is called the sensation of pain.

original: gang sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa'i reg bya reg pa las skyes pa lus dang sems kyis sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / dga' ba yang ma yin pa dang mi dga' ba yang ma yin pa myong ba ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa'i reg bya reg pa las skyes pa lus dang sems kyis sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / dga' ba yang ma yin pa dang mi dga' ba yang ma yin pa myong ba ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The contact that produces the sensation that is neither pleasant nor painful, which is felt and perceived as neither pleasant nor unpleasant, neither agreeable nor disagreeable, by the body and the mind, is called the sensation that is neither pleasant nor painful.

original: 'phags ma bde ba'i tshor ba la gang zhig rgyas par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'phags ma bde ba'i tshor ba la gang zhig rgyas par 'gyur /
translated: Noble lady, what increases in the pleasant sensation?

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la gang zhig rgyas par 'gyur /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la gang zhig rgyas par 'gyur /
translated: What increases in the painful sensation?

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la gang zhig rgyas par 'gyur /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la gang zhig rgyas par 'gyur /
translated: What increases in the sensation that is neither pleasant nor painful?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga bde ba'i tshor ba la 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga bde ba'i tshor ba la 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Venerable Subhūti, attachment increases in relation to pleasant feeling.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la zhe sdang rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la zhe sdang rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Aversion increases in relation to painful feeling.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la gti mug rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la gti mug rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Delusion increases in relation to neither painful nor pleasant feeling.

original: 'phags ma bde ba'i tshor ba thams cad la 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'phags ma bde ba'i tshor ba thams cad la 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ram /
translated: “Noble Subhūti, does attachment increase in relation to all pleasant feelings?

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba thams cad la zhe sdang rgyas par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba thams cad la zhe sdang rgyas par 'gyur ram /
translated: Does aversion increase in relation to all painful feelings?

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba thams cad la gti mug rgyas par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba thams cad la gti mug rgyas par 'gyur ram /
translated: Does delusion increase in relation to all neither painful nor pleasant feelings?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga bde ba'i tshor ba thams cad la 'dod chags rgyas pa ma yin la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga bde ba'i tshor ba thams cad la 'dod chags rgyas pa ma yin la /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, attachment does not increase in relation to all pleasant feelings.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba thams cad la zhe sdang rgyas pa ma yin zhing bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin @10a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba thams cad la zhe sdang rgyas pa ma yin zhing bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin @10a * //
translated: Aversion does not increase in relation to all painful feelings, and delusion does not increase in relation to all neither painful nor pleasant feelings.

original: pa'i tshor ba thams cad la gti mug rgyas pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: pa'i tshor ba thams cad la gti mug rgyas pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Although delusion increases in all feelings,

original: bde ba'i tshor ba gang la 'dod chags rgyas par mi 'gyur zhing spong bar 'gyur ba yod la /🔽sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba gang la zhe sdang rgyas par mi 'gyur zhing spong bar 'gyur ba yod la /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba gang la 'dod chags rgyas par mi 'gyur zhing spong bar 'gyur ba yod la / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba gang la zhe sdang rgyas par mi 'gyur zhing spong bar 'gyur ba yod la /
translated: there is a pleasant feeling in which attachment does not increase and is abandoned.🔽There is a painful feeling in which aversion does not increase and is abandoned.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la gti mug rgyas par mi 'gyur zhing spong bar 'gyur ba yang yod do //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la gti mug rgyas par mi 'gyur zhing spong bar 'gyur ba yang yod do //
translated: There is a feeling that is neither pleasant nor painful in which delusion does not increase and is abandoned.

original: 'phags ma bde ba'i tshor ba 'dod chags rgyas par mi 'gyur zhing spong bar 'gyur ba gang /
analyzed: 'phags ma bde ba'i tshor ba 'dod chags rgyas par mi 'gyur zhing spong bar 'gyur ba gang /
translated: Noble lady, what is the pleasant feeling in which attachment does not increase and is abandoned?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos 'dod pa las dben pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos 'dod pa las dben pa /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, here an ārya śrāvaka, separated from desires,🔽separated from evil and nonvirtuous dharmas,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar sgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar sgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He establishes and dwells in the first concentration, which is free from desires and bad, nonvirtuous qualities, and is accompanied by applied and sustained thought, and is born of exclusion and delight.

original: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang ba sems kyi rnam pa gcig tu gyur nas rtog pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa nye bar bsgrubs🔽te gnas so //
analyzed: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang ba sems kyi rnam pa gcig tu gyur nas rtog pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He establishes and dwells in the second concentration, which is born of concentration that is free from applied and sustained thought, and is accompanied by delight and joy.🔽He establishes and dwells in the third concentration, which is born of mindfulness, alertness, and a blissful body, and is accompanied by equanimity.

original: de dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral nas btang snyoms su gnas te dran pa dang shes bzhin can bde ba lus kyis so sor myong zhing gang 'phags pa rnams kyi btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa dran pa dang / bde bar gnas pa bsam gtan gsum pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral nas btang snyoms su gnas te dran pa dang shes bzhin can bde ba lus kyis so sor myong zhing gang 'phags pa rnams kyi btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa dran pa dang / bde bar gnas pa bsam gtan gsum pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He establishes and dwells in the fourth concentration, which is free from pleasure and pain, free from mental joy and mental sorrow, and is accompanied by pure equanimity and mindfulness.

original: 'di ni bde ba'i tshor ba la 'dod chags rgyas par mi 'gyur zhing spong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bde ba'i tshor ba la 'dod chags rgyas par mi 'gyur zhing spong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “the pleasant feeling in which attachment does not increase and is abandoned.”

original: 'phags ma sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la zhe sdang rgyas par mi 'gyur zhing spong bar 'gyur ba gang /
analyzed: 'phags ma sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la zhe sdang rgyas par mi 'gyur zhing spong bar 'gyur ba gang /
translated: “Noble sir, what is the painful feeling in which aversion does not increase and is abandoned?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos thar pa bla ma la 'dod pa skyed de bdag nam de'i skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos thar pa bla ma la 'dod pa skyed de bdag nam de'i skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas par 'gyur /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, here a noble disciple arouses longing for the highest freedom, thinking, ‘When will I have attained the noble’s freedom, and be living in it?’

original: gang gi tshe 'phags pa'i skye mched nye bar bsgrubs nas gnas zhes thar pa bla ma 'dod pa dang / don du gnyer ba dang / yongs su gdung ba dang / yid mi bde ba 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba zhe sdang rgyas par mi 'gyur zhing spong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'phags pa'i skye mched nye bar bsgrubs nas gnas zhes thar pa bla ma 'dod pa dang / don du gnyer ba dang / yongs su gdung ba dang / yid mi bde ba 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba zhe sdang rgyas par mi 'gyur zhing spong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When he longs for the highest freedom, strives for it, is tormented and anxious about it, this is called ‘the painful feeling in which aversion does not increase and is abandoned.’

original: 'phags ma bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba @10b la gti mug rgyas par mi 'gyur zhing spong bar 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags ma bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba @10b la gti mug rgyas par mi 'gyur zhing spong bar 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
translated: “Noble lady, what is the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant, in which delusion does not increase and is abandoned?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos bde ba yang spangs /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa ga 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos bde ba yang spangs /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, here a noble disciple abandons pleasure,

original: sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing snga ma bzhin du yid bde ba dang mi bde ba nub cing bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing snga ma bzhin du yid bde ba dang mi bde ba nub cing bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: abandons pain, and previously abandoned mental satisfaction and mental dissatisfaction, and attains the fourth meditative absorption, which is purified and without disturbance, and remains in it.

original: 'di ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la gti mug rgyas par mi 'gyur zhing spong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la gti mug rgyas par mi 'gyur zhing spong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant, in which delusion does not increase and is abandoned.”

original: 'phags ma bde ba'i tshor ba cis bde ba yin /🔽cis sdug bsngal ba yin /
analyzed: 'phags ma bde ba'i tshor ba cis bde ba yin / cis sdug bsngal ba yin /
translated: “Noble lady, why is pleasant feeling pleasant?🔽Why is it painful?

original: cis nye bar 'tshe ba yin /
analyzed: cis nye bar 'tshe ba yin /
translated: Why is it a calamity?”

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba cis bde ba yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba cis bde ba yin /
translated: How is a pleasant feeling pleasant?

original: cis sdug bsngal ba yin /🔽cis nye bar 'tsho ba yin /
analyzed: cis sdug bsngal ba yin / cis nye bar 'tsho ba yin /
translated: How is it painful?🔽How is it a form of distress?

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba cis bde ba yin //🔽cis sdug bsngal ba yin /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba cis bde ba yin // cis sdug bsngal ba yin /
translated: How is a neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling pleasant?🔽How is it painful?

original: cis nye bar 'tshe ba yin /
analyzed: cis nye bar 'tshe ba yin /
translated: How is it a form of distress?

translated: fond, and strongly attached,🔽and to which one clings,🔽any feeling, any perception, any volitional formation, any consciousness of the past, future, or present,

original: mngon par zhen pa dang / tshor ba gang dang / @12b 'du shes gang dang / 'du byed gang dang / rnam par shes pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba gang la 'dun pa'am /🔽chags pa'am / zhen pa'am /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa dang / tshor ba gang dang / @12b 'du shes gang dang / 'du byed gang dang / rnam par shes pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba gang la 'dun pa'am / chags pa'am / zhen pa'am /
translated: to which one is attracted,🔽attached,

original: dga' ba'am / chags zhen nam /
analyzed: dga' ba'am / chags zhen nam /
translated: fond, and strongly attached,🔽and to which one clings,

original: mngon par zhen pa 'di ni nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa 'di ni nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: these are called the appropriated aggregates.

original: dge slong dag phung po dang nye bar len pa'i phung po ji skad bstan pa 'di rab tu bstan to zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: dge slong dag phung po dang nye bar len pa'i phung po ji skad bstan pa 'di rab tu bstan to zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: Monks, I have taught the aggregates and the appropriated aggregates as they truly are.🔽This very meaning is explained in the Sūtra on the Laywoman

original: don 'di nyid dge slong ma chos sbyin gyi mdo las yi ge gzhan dang nges pa'i tshig gzhan gyis bshad de /
analyzed: don 'di nyid dge slong ma chos sbyin gyi mdo las yi ge gzhan dang nges pa'i tshig gzhan gyis bshad de /
translated: Dharmadinnā with different words and a different phrasing.

original: 'phags ma phung po dang nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bshad pa ;
analyzed: 'phags ma phung po dang nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bshad pa ;
translated: Noble lady, it is explained as the aggregates and the appropriated aggregates.

original: 'phags ma phung po gang yin pa de nyid nye bar len pa'i phung po yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags ma phung po gang yin pa de nyid nye bar len pa'i phung po yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus pa'o //
translated: Noble lady, are the aggregates themselves the appropriated aggregates?

original: 'jig pas 'jig rten no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig pas 'jig rten no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The world is so called because of destruction.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting is in Śrāvastī.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dran pa bcom ldan 'das gang na bder nye bar song ste nye bar 'ongs nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dran pa bcom ldan 'das gang na bder nye bar song ste nye bar 'ongs nas /
translated: Then the venerable Sāriputta approached the Blessed One, and having approached,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: he bowed down with his head at the Blessed One’s feet, and then sat down to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa dran pas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa dran pas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having sat down to one side, the venerable Sāriputta said this to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa 'jig rten 'jig rten zhes bshad pa ci'i phyir 'jig rten zhes bgyi /
analyzed: btsun pa 'jig rten 'jig rten zhes bshad pa ci'i phyir 'jig rten zhes bgyi /
translated: “Venerable sir, it is said, ‘the world, the world.’ For what reason is it called ‘the world’?”

original: dran pa 'jig cing rab tu 'jig pa ste //
analyzed: dran pa 'jig cing rab tu 'jig pa ste //
translated: Sāriputta, it is because of destruction, because of complete destruction,

original: rab tu 'jig cing rab tu 'jig pas 'jig rten zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'jig cing rab tu 'jig pas 'jig rten zhes bya'o //
translated: because of complete destruction and complete destruction that it is called ‘the world.’”

original: ci 'jig cing rab tu 'jig / dran pa mig rab tu 'jig cing 'jig pa dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / gang gi tshe yang mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba dang /
analyzed: ci 'jig cing rab tu 'jig / dran pa mig rab tu 'jig cing 'jig pa dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / gang gi tshe yang mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba dang /
translated: When the eye is destroyed and utterly destroyed, form, eye consciousness, eye contact, and whatever feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact, whether pleasant,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa de'i tshe yang 'jig cing rab tu 'jig ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa de'i tshe yang 'jig cing rab tu 'jig ste /
translated: unpleasant, or neither unpleasant nor pleasant, is also destroyed and utterly destroyed.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang lus dang / yid 'jig cing rab tu 'jig pa dang / gang gi tshe chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba dang /🔽sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa de'i tshe yang @13a * //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang lus dang / yid 'jig cing rab tu 'jig pa dang / gang gi tshe chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa de'i tshe yang @13a * //
translated: When the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are destroyed and utterly destroyed, phenomena, mind consciousness, mind contact, and whatever feeling that arises from the condition of mind contact, whether pleasant,

original: 'jig cing rab tu 'jig ste /
analyzed: 'jig cing rab tu 'jig ste /
translated: unpleasant, or neither unpleasant nor pleasant, is also destroyed and utterly destroyed.

original: 'jig cing rab tu 'jig pa de'i 'jig cing rab tu 'jig pas dran pa de'i phyir 'jig rten zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig cing rab tu 'jig pa de'i 'jig cing rab tu 'jig pas dran pa de'i phyir 'jig rten zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is destroyed and utterly destroyed is the world because of that destruction and utter destruction of mindfulness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang / tshe dang ldan pa dran pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la rjes su yi rang zhing mngon par dga'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang / tshe dang ldan pa dran pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la rjes su yi rang zhing mngon par dga'o //
translated: The Blessed One having spoken thus, the venerable Anuruddha rejoiced in and was delighted by the Blessed One’s words.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du mig gi nang gi skye mched de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du mig gi nang gi skye mched de zhes bya ba la /
translated: As the Blessed One said, “The eye is the internal sense base”:

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting was in Śrāvastī.

original: de nas dge slong gzhan zhig bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste nye bar 'ongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: de nas dge slong gzhan zhig bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste nye bar 'ongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: Then another monk approached where the Blessed One was staying. Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having sat to one side, he said this to the Blessed One:🔽“Blessed One, it is said, ‘The eye is the internal sense base.’

original: btsun pa mig ni nang gi skyes mched de zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan gyi rgyas par ni rnam par ma phye na /
analyzed: btsun pa mig ni nang gi skyes mched de zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan gyi rgyas par ni rnam par ma phye na /
translated: Venerable, the Blessed One taught that the eye is an internal sense base, but he did not elaborate.

original: btsun pa ji ltar mig nang gi skye mched lags /
analyzed: btsun pa ji ltar mig nang gi skye mched lags /
translated: Venerable, how is the eye an internal sense base?

original: dge slong mig ni nang gi skye mched de /
analyzed: dge slong mig ni nang gi skye mched de /
translated: Bhikṣus, the eye is an internal sense base.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba gzugs dang pa gzugs can bstan du med pa thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //🔽mig ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba gzugs dang pa gzugs can bstan du med pa thogs pa dang bcas pa'o // mig ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: It is derived from the four great elements, is a form that is invisible and has resistance.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang lus kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang lus kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Just as the eye is, so are the ear, nose, tongue, and body.

original: btsun pa yid ni nang gi skye mched yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan gyi rgyas par ni rnam par ma phye na /
analyzed: btsun pa yid ni nang gi skye mched yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan gyi rgyas par ni rnam par ma phye na /
translated: Venerable, the Blessed One taught that the mind is an internal sense base, but he did not elaborate.

original: btsun pa ji ltar yid nang gi skye mched lags /
analyzed: btsun pa ji ltar yid nang gi skye mched lags /
translated: Venerable, how is the mind an internal sense base?

original: dge slong yid ni nang gi skye mched de /
analyzed: dge slong yid ni nang gi skye mched de /
translated: Bhikṣus, the mind is an internal sense base.

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa bstan du med cing thogs ba med pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa bstan du med cing thogs ba med pa'o //
translated: It is the mind, thought, and consciousness that is not form, is invisible, and has no resistance.

original: btsun pa gzugs ni phyi'i skye mched de zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan gyi /
analyzed: btsun pa gzugs ni phyi'i skye mched de zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan gyi /
translated: Venerable, the Blessed One taught that form is the external sense base,

original: rgyas par ni rnam par ma phye na /
analyzed: rgyas par ni rnam par ma phye na /
translated: but he did not elaborate.

original: btsun pa ji ltar na gzugs phyi'i skye mched lags /
analyzed: btsun pa ji ltar na gzugs phyi'i skye mched lags /
translated: Venerable, how is form the external sense base?

original: dge slong gzugs ni phyi'i skye mched de /
analyzed: dge slong gzugs ni phyi'i skye mched de /
translated: Monks, form is the external sense base.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is derived from the four great elements and is visible and resistant.

original: de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / btsun pa reg bya ni phyi'i skye mched yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / btsun pa reg bya ni phyi'i skye mched yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan gyi /
translated: Venerable, the Blessed One taught that sound, smell, taste, and tactile objects are the external sense bases,

original: rgyas par ni rnam par ma phye na /
analyzed: rgyas par ni rnam par ma phye na /
translated: but he did not elaborate.

original: btsun pa ji ltar na reg bya phyi'i skye mched lags /
analyzed: btsun pa ji ltar na reg bya phyi'i skye mched lags /
translated: Venerable, how are tactile objects the external sense base?

original: dge @13b slong dag rig bya ni phyi'i skye mched de 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi rgyur byas pa gzugs can bstan du med cing thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: dge @13b slong dag rig bya ni phyi'i skye mched de 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi rgyur byas pa gzugs can bstan du med cing thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Monks, tactile objects are the external sense base. They are derived from the four great elements and are invisible and resistant.

original: btsun pa chos ni phyi'i skye mched de zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan gyi /
analyzed: btsun pa chos ni phyi'i skye mched de zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan gyi /
translated: Venerable, the Blessed One taught that the Dharma is an external sense sphere.

original: rgyas par ni rnam par ma phye na /
analyzed: rgyas par ni rnam par ma phye na /
translated: But he did not elaborate.

original: btsun pa ji ltar chos phyi'i skye mched lags /
analyzed: btsun pa ji ltar chos phyi'i skye mched lags /
translated: Venerable, how is the Dharma an external sense sphere?

original: dge slong chos ni phyi'i skye mched de /
analyzed: dge slong chos ni phyi'i skye mched de /
translated: Monk, the Dharma is an external sense sphere.

original: skye mched bcu gcig gis ma bsdus pa'i chos kyi skye mched de bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gcig gis ma bsdus pa'i chos kyi skye mched de bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: It is the sense sphere of mental objects not included in the other eleven sense spheres. It is not visible and it is not impeded.

original: de nas dge slong de stan las langs te song ngo //
analyzed: de nas dge slong de stan las langs te song ngo //
translated: Then that monk rose from his seat and left.

original: rab tu byed pa dang mdo sde las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa dang mdo sde las zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the treatise and in the sutras.

original: lag pa brdabs pa'i dpe'i mdo las ji ltar 'byung ba bzhin te /
analyzed: lag pa brdabs pa'i dpe'i mdo las ji ltar 'byung ba bzhin te /
translated: As it appears in the Sutra of the Example of the Hand.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting was in Śrāvastī.

original: de nas dge slong gzhan zhig gcig pu dben pa na ting nge 'dzin na gnas pa na bdag gi bdag gang yin /🔽cis bdag gi bdag yin /
analyzed: de nas dge slong gzhan zhig gcig pu dben pa na ting nge 'dzin na gnas pa na bdag gi bdag gang yin / cis bdag gi bdag yin /
translated: Then another monk, while dwelling alone, secluded, in meditative concentration, thought, “What is my self?🔽What is my self like?

original: ji ltar bdag gi bdag yin /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gi bdag yin /
translated: How is my self?

original: gang la bdag gi bdag yin zhes 'di lta bu sems la dpyod pa skyes te /
analyzed: gang la bdag gi bdag yin zhes 'di lta bu sems la dpyod pa skyes te /
translated: What is the self that I have?

original: de nas dge slong de ting nge 'dzin las langs te /
analyzed: de nas dge slong de ting nge 'dzin las langs te /
translated: Then the monk rose from his concentration,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ngo //
translated: and went to where the Blessed One was.🔽Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.

original: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go / phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas /
analyzed: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go / phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas /
translated: Sitting to one side,

original: dge slong des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽btsun pa bdag 'di na gcig pu dben pa na ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa na bdag gi bdag gang yin /
analyzed: dge slong des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to // btsun pa bdag 'di na gcig pu dben pa na ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa na bdag gi bdag gang yin /
translated: the monk said this to the Blessed One:

original: cis gdag  gi bdag yin /🔽ji ltar bdag gi bdag yin /
analyzed: cis gdag  gi bdag yin / ji ltar bdag gi bdag yin /
translated: Venerable One, while I was alone in seclusion, abiding in concentration, the thought arose in my mind: What is my self?🔽By what am I defined as a self?🔽How am I defined as a self?

original: gang la bdag gi bdag yin zhes 'di lta bu sems la rnam par dpyod ba skyes so //
analyzed: gang la bdag gi bdag yin zhes 'di lta bu sems la rnam par dpyod ba skyes so //
translated: What is the self that I have?

original: dge slong legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang gnyis shig bstan cing bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang gnyis shig bstan cing bshad par bya'o //
translated: Monk, listen well and keep this in mind. I will teach and explain the two.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: mig dang gzugs dang / rna ba dang sgra dang / sna dang dri dang / lce dang ro dang / lus dang reg bya dang / yid dang / chos te /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang / rna ba dang sgra dang / sna dang dri dang / lce dang ro dang / lus dang reg bya dang / yid dang / chos te /
translated: eye and form, ear and sound, nose and smell, tongue and taste, body and touch, mind and dharmas.

original: 'di ni gnyis zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the ‘two.’

original: dge slong gang zhig dge sbyong goo ta mas gnyis bstan pa de bdag gis bsal te /🔽gzhan gnyis bstan par bya'o zhes pa ni tshig tsam du zad cing dri ba'i lan yongs su mi shes pa yin zhing slar la kun @14a * //
analyzed: dge slong gang zhig dge sbyong goo ta mas gnyis bstan pa de bdag gis bsal te / gzhan gnyis bstan par bya'o zhes pa ni tshig tsam du zad cing dri ba'i lan yongs su mi shes pa yin zhing slar la kun @14a * //
translated: “Whatever monk, O mendicant, the son of the Gautama teaches as the ‘two,’ I will refute.

original: tu rmongs pa skyes pa dang yang dag pa'i yul can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: tu rmongs pa skyes pa dang yang dag pa'i yul can ma yin pa ste /
translated: I will teach another ‘two.’ ” This is mere verbiage, and he does not understand the answer to the question. He is confused, and he is not in the right.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ste /
translated: “The eye and form are the basis for the arising of eye-consciousness.

original: dge slong de la gang nang gi rkyen gyi bdag nyid mig gi sha'i gong bu la sra ba dang mkhrang bar gyur ba zin pa 'di ni mig gi sha'i gong bu la nang gi bdag nyid kyi sa'i khams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong de la gang nang gi rkyen gyi bdag nyid mig gi sha'i gong bu la sra ba dang mkhrang bar gyur ba zin pa 'di ni mig gi sha'i gong bu la nang gi bdag nyid kyi sa'i khams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “In this regard, O monk, the solidity and hardness that are appropriated in the fleshy part of the eye are called the earth element in the eye’s inner sense-center.

original: dge slong de la gang nang gi rkyen gyi bdag nyid mig gi sha'i gong bu la chu dang chur gyur pa brlan pa dang mnyen pa dang mnyen par gyur pa dang zin pa 'di ni mig gi sha'i gong bu la nang gi bdag nyid kyi chu'i khams zhes🔽bya'o // dge slong de la nang gi rkyen gyi bdag nyid mig gi sha'i gong bu la me dang mer gyur pa dang / dro ba dang dro bar gyur pa zin par gyur pa 'di ni mig gi sha'i gong bu nang gi bdag nyid kyi me'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong de la gang nang gi rkyen gyi bdag nyid mig gi sha'i gong bu la chu dang chur gyur pa brlan pa dang mnyen pa dang mnyen par gyur pa dang zin pa 'di ni mig gi sha'i gong bu la nang gi bdag nyid kyi chu'i khams zhes bya'o // dge slong de la nang gi rkyen gyi bdag nyid mig gi sha'i gong bu la me dang mer gyur pa dang / dro ba dang dro bar gyur pa zin par gyur pa 'di ni mig gi sha'i gong bu nang gi bdag nyid kyi me'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: “That monk should think, ‘In the fleshy part of my eye, which is an inner condition, there is the water element, which is watery, watery in nature, moistening, moistening in nature, and appropriated. This is called the inner water element in the fleshy part of the eye.🔽“That monk should think, ‘In the fleshy part of my eye, which is an inner condition, there is the fire element, which is fiery, fiery in nature, burning, burning in nature, and appropriated. This is called the inner fire element in the fleshy part of the eye.🔽“That monk should think, ‘In the fleshy part of my eye, which is an inner condition, there is the wind element, which is windy, windy in nature, blowing, blowing in nature, and appropriated. This is called the inner wind element in the fleshy part of the eye.

original: dge slong de la nang gi rkyen gyi bdag nyid kyi mig gi sha'i gong bu la rlung dang rlung du gyur pa yang ba dang g-yo bar gyur ba zin pa 'di ni mig gi sha'i gong bu la nang gi bdag nyid kyi rlung gi khams zhes bya ba'o🔽// dge slong 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong de la nang gi rkyen gyi bdag nyid kyi mig gi sha'i gong bu la rlung dang rlung du gyur pa yang ba dang g-yo bar gyur ba zin pa 'di ni mig gi sha'i gong bu la nang gi bdag nyid kyi rlung gi khams zhes bya ba'o🔽// dge slong 'di lta ste /
translated: “That monk should think, ‘In the fleshy part of my eye, which is an inner condition, there is the space element, which is spacious, spacious in nature, hollow, hollow in nature, and appropriated. This is called the inner space element in the fleshy part of the eye.🔽“That monk should think, ‘In the fleshy part of my eye, which is an inner condition, there is the consciousness element, which is consciousness, conscious in nature, and appropriated. This is called the inner consciousness element in the fleshy part of the eye.

original: lag pa gnyis sprad cing brdabs pa las sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / gsum 'dus pa'i reg pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis sprad cing brdabs pa las sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / gsum 'dus pa'i reg pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang /
translated: Together with that arises feeling, perception,

original: sems pa zhes bya ba ste /
