analyzed: 'di thams cad ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di nyid la sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran zhing dran pa'am /
translated: all of them recollect their manifold past abodes in dependence on these very five acquired aggregates.

original: dran par gyur pa'am yang dag par dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran par gyur pa'am yang dag par dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: They recollect, have recollected, and will recollect.

original: lnga gang zhe na /🔽dge sbyong ngam bram ze bdag 'das pa'i dus na gzugs dang ldan par gyur /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na / dge sbyong ngam bram ze bdag 'das pa'i dus na gzugs dang ldan par gyur /
translated: What are the five?🔽“Monks, any ascetics or brahmins who recollect their manifold past abodes, recollecting and remembering,

original: 'di lta bu'i gzugs dang ldan par gyur zhes sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma yang dag par rjes su dran zhing yang dag par rjes su dran pa dang / yang dag par rjes su dran par gyur pa dang / yang dag par rjes su dran par gyur ba dang /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i gzugs dang ldan par gyur zhes sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma yang dag par rjes su dran zhing yang dag par rjes su dran pa dang / yang dag par rjes su dran par gyur pa dang / yang dag par rjes su dran par gyur ba dang /
translated: recollected and remembered, and will recollect and remember, ‘In the past I had such a form and was of such a kind,’

original: dge sbyong ngam bram ze 'das pa'i dus na rnam par shes pa dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: dge sbyong ngam bram ze 'das pa'i dus na rnam par shes pa dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: “Monks, brahmins, and others who have the consciousness of the past

original: 'di lta bu'i rnam par shes pa dang ldan par gyur zhes sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma yang dag par rjes su dran zhing yang dag par rjes su dran pa dang / yang dag par rjes su dran par gyur pa dang / yang dag par rjes su dran par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rnam par shes pa dang ldan par gyur zhes sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma yang dag par rjes su dran zhing yang dag par rjes su dran pa dang / yang dag par rjes su dran par gyur pa dang / yang dag par rjes su dran par 'gyur te /
translated: and who remember their past lives in various ways, who have remembered, who will remember, and who are remembering,

original: dge slong dag gzugs ni gzugs su rung bas gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag gzugs ni gzugs su rung bas gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: “Monks, form is called the form aggregate because it is suitable as form.

original: cis gzugs su rung zhe na /
analyzed: cis gzugs su rung zhe na /
translated: What is it suitable for?

original: lag pa'i reg pas reg par bya bas gzugs su rung ba dang / bong ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / dbyug pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / mtshon gyi 'dus te reg pa dang ; grang ba dang / dro ba dang / bkres pa dang /
analyzed: lag pa'i reg pas reg par bya bas gzugs su rung ba dang / bong ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / dbyug pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / mtshon gyi 'dus te reg pa dang ; grang ba dang / dro ba dang / bkres pa dang /
translated: It is suitable for contact with the hand, contact with a clod, contact with a stick, contact with a knife, cold, heat, hunger, thirst, lightness, heaviness, softness, and roughness.

original: skom pa dang / sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang dang / rlung dang / nyi ma dang / sdig sbrul gyi 'dus te reg pas reg na /
analyzed: skom pa dang / sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang dang / rlung dang / nyi ma dang / sdig sbrul gyi 'dus te reg pas reg na /
translated: thirst, flies, bees, wind, sun, and snakes.

original: reg tu yod cing gzugs su rung bas gzugs te /
analyzed: reg tu yod cing gzugs su rung bas gzugs te /
translated: It is form because it is touchable and suitable as form.

original: de'i phyir gzugs su rung bas gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs su rung bas gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the form aggregate that is appropriated.

original: gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po de yang mi rtag pa sdug bsngal ba yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po de yang mi rtag pa sdug bsngal ba yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
translated: Moreover, that form aggregate that is appropriated is impermanent, suffering, and subject to change.

original: dge slong tshor zhing myong bas na tshor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong tshor zhing myong bas na tshor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: “Sensation is called that because it is felt and experienced by a monk.

original: de'i phyir tshor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the sensation aggregate that is appropriated.

original: ci tshor zhe na /
analyzed: ci tshor zhe na /
translated: What is sensation?🔽It is called sensation because it is felt and experienced as pleasant, painful, or neither painful nor pleasant.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong bas dge slong dag de'i phyir tshor zhing myong bas tshor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong bas dge slong dag de'i phyir tshor zhing myong bas tshor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, monks, it is called the sensation aggregate that is appropriated.

original: tshor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po de yang mi rtag pa sdug bsngal ba yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: tshor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po de yang mi rtag pa sdug bsngal ba yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
translated: This aggregate of grasping at feeling is impermanent, suffering, and subject to change.

original: dge slong dag @16b 'dus te shes pas 'du shes te de'i phyir 'du shes nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag @16b 'dus te shes pas 'du shes te de'i phyir 'du shes nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: “Monks, it is because of the coming together of the six sense bases that there is contact. Therefore, it is called the aggregate of grasping at contact.

original: ci 'dus te shes she na /
analyzed: ci 'dus te shes she na /
translated: What is the coming together of the six sense bases?

original: chung du 'dus te shes pa dang / rgya chen po dang tshad med pa dang / cung zad med do zhes cung zad med pa yang rab tu shes te /
analyzed: chung du 'dus te shes pa dang / rgya chen po dang tshad med pa dang / cung zad med do zhes cung zad med pa yang rab tu shes te /
translated: It is the coming together of the sense base of the eye, the sense base of the ear, the sense base of the nose, the sense base of the tongue, the sense base of the body, and the sense base of thought.

original: dge slong dag 'dus te shes pas de'i phyir 'du shes nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'dus te shes pas de'i phyir 'du shes nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: Monks, it is because of the coming together of the six sense bases that there is contact. Therefore, it is called the aggregate of grasping at contact.

original: 'du shes nye bar len pa'i phung po de yang mi rtag pa sdug bsngal ba yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: 'du shes nye bar len pa'i phung po de yang mi rtag pa sdug bsngal ba yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
translated: This aggregate of grasping at contact is impermanent, suffering, and subject to change.

original: dge slong dag 'du byed mngon par 'dus byas shing 'du byed mngon par 'du byed pa de'i phyir 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'du byed mngon par 'dus byas shing 'du byed mngon par 'du byed pa de'i phyir 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: “Monks, it is because of the formation of formations that there are formations. Therefore, it is called the aggregate of grasping at formations.

original: cis 'du byed mngon par 'du byed ce na /
analyzed: cis 'du byed mngon par 'du byed ce na /
translated: Why is it that formations are formed?

original: gzugs 'dus byas mngon par 'du byed pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa 'dus byas mngon par 'du byed de /
analyzed: gzugs 'dus byas mngon par 'du byed pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa 'dus byas mngon par 'du byed de /
translated: Formations are formed in relation to conditioned form, conditioned feeling, conditioned perception, conditioned volitional factors, and conditioned consciousness.

original: dge slong dag 'dus byas mngon par 'du byed cing 'dus byas mngon par 'du byed pa de'i phyir 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'dus byas mngon par 'du byed cing 'dus byas mngon par 'du byed pa de'i phyir 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: Monks, formations are formed and because formations are formed, they are called the appropriated aggregates of formations.

original: 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po de yang mi rtag pa sdug bsngal ba yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po de yang mi rtag pa sdug bsngal ba yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
translated: Moreover, monks, that appropriated aggregate of formations is impermanent, suffering, and subject to change.

original: dge slong dag rnam par shes shing rab tu shes pa de'i phyir rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: dge slong dag rnam par shes shing rab tu shes pa de'i phyir rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o ;
translated: Monks, because it cognizes and fully cognizes, it is called the appropriated aggregate of consciousness.

original: / ci zhig rnam par shes she na /
analyzed: / ci zhig rnam par shes she na /
translated: What does it cognize?

original: gzugs rnam par shes pa dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnam par shes te /
analyzed: gzugs rnam par shes pa dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnam par shes te /
translated: It cognizes form, it cognizes sound, it cognizes smell, it cognizes taste, it cognizes tangibles, and it cognizes mental phenomena.

original: dge slong dag rnam par shes shing rab tu shes pa de'i phyir rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag rnam par shes shing rab tu shes pa de'i phyir rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: “Monks, because it is cognized and well cognized, it is called the aggregate of consciousness that appropriates.

original: dge slong dag rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po de yang mi rtag pa sdug bsngal ba yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: dge slong dag rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po de yang mi rtag pa sdug bsngal ba yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
translated: Monks, this aggregate of consciousness that appropriates is impermanent, suffering, and subject to change.

original: dge slong dag de la 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'di ltar yang dag par rab tu slob par byed de /
analyzed: dge slong dag de la 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'di ltar yang dag par rab tu slob par byed de /
translated: Monks, the noble disciple who has heard the Dharma and is skilled in the teaching trains like this:

original: bdag da ltar da ltar byung ba'i gzugs kyis bcom ste 'di lta ste bdag da ltar da ltar byung ba'i gzugs kyis bcom pa de bzhin du 'das pa'i dus kyi gzugs kyis bdag bcom mo //
analyzed: bdag da ltar da ltar byung ba'i gzugs kyis bcom ste 'di lta ste bdag da ltar da ltar byung ba'i gzugs kyis bcom pa de bzhin du 'das pa'i dus kyi gzugs kyis bdag bcom mo //
translated: ‘I am now destroyed by present form. Just as I am now destroyed by present form, so in the past I was destroyed by past form.

original: bdag da ltar da ltar byung ba'i gzugs kyis bcom pa na yang 'das pa'i gzugs la mngon par dga' ste /
analyzed: bdag da ltar da ltar byung ba'i gzugs kyis bcom pa na yang 'das pa'i gzugs la mngon par dga' ste /
translated: When I am destroyed by present form, I delight in past form.

original: de'i tshe yang de dang 'dra ba nyid du shes par @17a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang de dang 'dra ba nyid du shes par @17a * //
translated: At that time, I am just like that.

original: byas nas 'das pa'i gzugs la ltos par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: byas nas 'das pa'i gzugs la ltos par mi 'gyur /
translated: He does not rely on past form.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par dga' bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par dga' bar mi 'gyur /
translated: He does not delight in future form.

original: da ltar byung ba'i gzugs la skyo ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gog pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i gzugs la skyo ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gog pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes disenchanted with and detached from present form, and he attains its cessation.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'di ltar yang dag par rjes su slob par byed de /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'di ltar yang dag par rjes su slob par byed de /
translated: The noble disciple who is learned trains like this:

original: bdag da ltar da ltar byung ba'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / da ltar byung ba'i rnam par shes pa bcom ste /
analyzed: bdag da ltar da ltar byung ba'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / da ltar byung ba'i rnam par shes pa bcom ste /
translated: ‘I have destroyed present feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽da ltar byung ba'i gzugs kyis bcom pa de bzhin du bdag 'das pa'i dus kyi rnam par shes pas bcom mo //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / da ltar byung ba'i gzugs kyis bcom pa de bzhin du bdag 'das pa'i dus kyi rnam par shes pas bcom mo //
translated: Just as🔽I have destroyed present form, so I will destroy past consciousness.

original: bdag da ltar byung ba'i rnam par shes pas bcom pa na yang ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par shes pa la mngon par dga' ste /
analyzed: bdag da ltar byung ba'i rnam par shes pas bcom pa na yang ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par shes pa la mngon par dga' ste /
translated: Even as I am destroying present consciousness, I will not delight in future consciousness.

original: de'i tshe yang de dang 'dra ba nyid du shes par byas nas 'das pa'i dus kyi rnam par shes pa la ltos par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang de dang 'dra ba nyid du shes par byas nas 'das pa'i dus kyi rnam par shes pa la ltos par mi 'gyur /
translated: At that time, having understood it to be just like that, he does not rely on past consciousness.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par shes pa la mngon par dga' bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par shes pa la mngon par dga' bar mi 'gyur /
translated: He does not delight in future consciousness.🔽He becomes disenchanted with and detached from present consciousness, and attains its cessation.🔽He does not diminish it and increase its power.🔽He does not diminish it and increase its power.🔽He does not diminish it and increase its power.

original: da ltar byung ba'i rnam par shes pa la skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i rnam par shes pa la skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: He does not diminish it and increase its power.🔽He does not diminish it and increase its power.🔽He does not diminish it and increase its power.🔽He does not diminish it and increase its power.🔽He does not diminish it and increase its power.🔽He does not diminish it and increase its power.

original: de nyams par byed cing mthu skyed par mi byed /🔽'grib par byed cing 'phel bar mi byed /🔽mi gsal bar byed cing gsal bar mi byed /🔽spong bar byed cing len par mi byed do //
analyzed: de nyams par byed cing mthu skyed par mi byed / 'grib par byed cing 'phel bar mi byed / mi gsal bar byed cing gsal bar mi byed / spong bar byed cing len par mi byed do //

analyzed: gzugs nyams par byed cing mthu skyed par mi byed do //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa nyams par byed cing mthu skyed par mi byed do //
translated: He does not diminish it and increase its power.🔽He does

original: ci zhig 'grib par byed cing 'phel bar mi byed ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig 'grib par byed cing 'phel bar mi byed ce na /
translated: What does it diminish and not increase?

original: gzugs 'grib par byed cing 'phel bar mi byed do //
analyzed: gzugs 'grib par byed cing 'phel bar mi byed do //
translated: It diminishes form and does not increase it.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'grib par byed cing 'phel bar mi byed do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'grib par byed cing 'phel bar mi byed do //
translated: It diminishes feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness and does not increase them.

original: ci zhig mi gsal bar byed cing gsal bar mi byed ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig mi gsal bar byed cing gsal bar mi byed ce na /
translated: What does it not clarify and clarify?

original: gzugs mi gsal bar byed cing gsal bar mi byed do //
analyzed: gzugs mi gsal bar byed cing gsal bar mi byed do //
translated: It does not clarify form and clarifies it.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi gsal bar byed cing gsal bar mi byed do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi gsal bar byed cing gsal bar mi byed do //
translated: It does not clarify feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness and clarifies them.

original: ci zhig spong bar byed cing len @17b par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig spong bar byed cing len @17b par mi byed ce na /
translated: What does it abandon and not take up?

original: gzugs spong bar byed cing len par mi byed do //
analyzed: gzugs spong bar byed cing len par mi byed do //
translated: It abandons form and does not take it up.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa sdong bar byed cing len par mi byed do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa sdong bar byed cing len par mi byed do //
translated: It abandons feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness and does not take them up.

original: nyams par byed cing mthu skyed par mi byed par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyams par byed cing mthu skyed par mi byed par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: It causes decline and does not cause increase.

original: 'grib par byed cing 'phel bar mi byed par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'grib par byed cing 'phel bar mi byed par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will diminish and not increase.

original: mi gsal bar byed cing gsal bar mi byed par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi gsal bar byed cing gsal bar mi byed par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be unclear and not clear.🔽They will abandon and not take up.

original: spong bar byed cing len par mi byed pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa ma yin pa so so rang gis rig cing shes nas /
analyzed: spong bar byed cing len par mi byed pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa ma yin pa so so rang gis rig cing shes nas /
translated: Having individually cognized and understood the afflictive and non-afflictive,

original: bdag gi skye ba zad do //🔽tshangs par spyod pa bsten no //
analyzed: bdag gi skye ba zad do // tshangs par spyod pa bsten no //
translated: they will say, 'My births are exhausted.🔽I have practiced pure conduct.

original: bya ba byas so //
analyzed: bya ba byas so //
translated: I have done what needed to be done.🔽I will know no other existence than this one.'

original: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'di ltar don gyi sde tshan las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar don gyi sde tshan las zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this way, in the chapter on meaning, it is said:

original: phran tshogs kyi don gyi sde tshan gyi mdo las /
analyzed: phran tshogs kyi don gyi sde tshan gyi mdo las /
translated: In the sutra of the chapter on meaning of the Minor Collection,

original: bse ru lta bu'i tshigs bcad kyi de ma thag tu bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: bse ru lta bu'i tshigs bcad kyi de ma thag tu bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: immediately after the verse on the rhinoceros-like, it is explained:

original: de la dang por mnyan yod na bram ze gzhan zhig gi 'bras kyi zhing brlag pa dang / chung ma shi ba'i sngon gyi skye ba'i gtam rgyal po rnam par rgyal ba'i sde la tshigs su bcad pa'i don las brtsams te bshad pa /
analyzed: de la dang por mnyan yod na bram ze gzhan zhig gi 'bras kyi zhing brlag pa dang / chung ma shi ba'i sngon gyi skye ba'i gtam rgyal po rnam par rgyal ba'i sde la tshigs su bcad pa'i don las brtsams te bshad pa /
translated: First, in Śrāvastī, a certain brahmin lost his rice field and his wife died. The story of his past life was told to King Vijayasena in verse, beginning with the meaning of the verse.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das gleng gzhi 'di dang / rgyu 'di dang don 'di lta bu byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das gleng gzhi 'di dang / rgyu 'di dang don 'di lta bu byung bar gyur te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, with this background, this cause, and this meaning,

original: don shes pa'i nga'i dge slong 'di lta bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

translated: all sensual pleasures as if they were snakes’ heads🔽will, through mindfulness,

analyzed: zhing dngos nor bu ba lang dang // rta dang 'bangs dang bud med @18a * //
translated: horses, servants, women,

analyzed: skyes bu gang zhig 'dod byed pa // stobs ldan nye bar 'tshe ba yis //

analyzed: stobs che de dag bcom par 'gyur //

original: dge slong dag nye bar len pa'i phung po ni lnga ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag nye bar len pa'i phung po ni lnga ste /
translated: “Monks, the appropriated aggregates are five.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The appropriated aggregate of form, the appropriated aggregate of feeling, the appropriated aggregate of notion, the appropriated aggregate of assembled factors, and the appropriated aggregate of consciousness.

original: gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the appropriated aggregate of form?

original: gzugs gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa ste /
translated: Whatever form there is, all of it is the four great elements and what is derived from the four great elements.

original: 'di ni gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the appropriated aggregate of form.

original: gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po de yang mi rtag pa /
analyzed: gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po de yang mi rtag pa /
translated: That appropriated aggregate of form is impermanent,

original: sdug bsngal ba /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba /
translated: suffering,

original: yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can te /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can te /

original: gang gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po ma lus par spangs shing nges par 'byung ba /
analyzed: gang gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po ma lus par spangs shing nges par 'byung ba /
translated: The aggregates that are appropriated by form are completely abandoned, and one definitely passes beyond them.

original: bcom pa / zad pa /
analyzed: bcom pa / zad pa /
translated: They are destroyed and exhausted.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: They are free from attachment.

original: 'gog pa / nye bar zhi ba /
analyzed: 'gog pa / nye bar zhi ba /

original: nus pa / gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po gzhan dang nying mtshams mi sbyor ba /
analyzed: nus pa / gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po gzhan dang nying mtshams mi sbyor ba /
translated: They are powerless. The aggregates that are appropriated by form do not link up with another existence.

original: nye bar len pa med pa /
analyzed: nye bar len pa med pa /
translated: They are not appropriated.

original: mi 'byung ba 'di nyid mchog yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi 'byung ba 'di nyid mchog yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: They do not arise. This is the highest.

original: nye bar len pa thams cad las nges par 'byung ba /
analyzed: nye bar len pa thams cad las nges par 'byung ba /
translated: It is the definite emergence from all appropriation.

original: srid pa zad pa /
analyzed: srid pa zad pa /
translated: It is the exhaustion of existence.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: It is free from attachment.

original: 'gog pa / mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa / mya ngan las 'das pa'o //

original: tshor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po gang zhe na /

original: tshor ba'i tshogs drug ste /
analyzed: tshor ba'i tshogs drug ste /

translated: the feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the eye, the feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the ear, the feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the nose, the feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the tongue, the feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the body, and the feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the mind.

original: 'di ni tshor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //

analyzed: tshor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po de yang snga ma bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du'o//
translated: And this aggregate of grasping feeling is also like the previous one, up to nirvana.

original: @18b 'du shas nye bar len pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: @18b 'du shas nye bar len pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aggregate of grasping perception?

original: 'du shes kyi tshogs drug ste /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi tshogs drug ste /
translated: It is the group of six perceptions.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i 'du shes dang / rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i 'du shes te /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i 'du shes dang / rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i 'du shes te /
translated: The perception that arises from the contact of eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: 'du shes nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o//
analyzed: 'du shes nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o//
translated: This is called the aggregate of grasping perception.

original: de yang snga ma bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de yang snga ma bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du'o //
translated: And this is also like the previous one, up to nirvana.

original: 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aggregate of grasping volitional formations?

original: sems pa'i tshogs drug ste /
analyzed: sems pa'i tshogs drug ste /
translated: It is the group of six intentions.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i 'du shes dang / rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang lus dang yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i 'du shes te /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i 'du shes dang / rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang lus dang yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i 'du shes te /

original: 'di ni 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the appropriating aggregate of volitional formations.

original: de yang snga ma bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de yang snga ma bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du'o //
translated: And that, as before, is up to nirvana.

original: rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the appropriating aggregate of consciousness?

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste /
translated: It is the six collections of consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: They are eye consciousness, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousness.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the appropriating aggregate of consciousness.

original: de yang snga ma bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de yang snga ma bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du'o //
translated: And that, as before, is up to nirvana.

original: dge slong dag gang chos 'di rnams shes rab chung ngus 'byed cing bzod la /
analyzed: dge slong dag gang chos 'di rnams shes rab chung ngus 'byed cing bzod la /
translated: Monks, those who, with lesser wisdom, discern these phenomena and are patient with them

original: so so'i skye bo'i sa las yang dag par 'das te yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i sa non cing rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ma thob la /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i sa las yang dag par 'das te yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i sa non cing rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ma thob la /
translated: will transcend the stage of ordinary beings and ascend to the stage of right and definite progress, but will not attain the fruit of stream-entry.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ma thob par bar skabs su dus byed par mi rigs pa 'di ni dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ma thob par bar skabs su dus byed par mi rigs pa 'di ni dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not right for them to die in the meantime without attaining the fruit of stream-entry. This is called the faith-follower.

original: dge slong dag gang chos 'di rnams la shes rab chen pos 'byed cing bzod la /
analyzed: dge slong dag gang chos 'di rnams la shes rab chen pos 'byed cing bzod la /
translated: Monks, those who, with great wisdom, discern these phenomena and are patient with them,

analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i sa non cing rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i bar snga ma bzhin no //
translated: and who have entered the stage of rightness, will abide in the fruit of stream-entry, as before.

original: dge slong dag gang chos rnams la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi shes rab kyis lta bar gyur cing 'di ni kun tu sbyor ba gsum spangs shing yongs su shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong dag gang chos rnams la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi shes rab kyis lta bar gyur cing 'di ni kun tu sbyor ba gsum spangs shing yongs su shes par 'gyur te /
translated: Monks, those who, with wisdom that is in accordance with reality, see phenomena will abandon and fully understand three fetters:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom mo //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom mo //
translated: the view of the transitory collection, the conceit “I am,” and wrong view.

original: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa byang chub pa'i mthar mi ltung ba nyid du nges pa'i chos can mchog tu thogs na @19a * //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa byang chub pa'i mthar mi ltung ba nyid du nges pa'i chos can mchog tu thogs na @19a * //
translated: This is the one who is destined to become a stream-enterer, who will not fall into miserable realms and is sure to attain awakening in no more than seven rebirths.

original: srid pa bdun du mi dang lha'i nang du nying mtshams sbyar nas sdug bsngal mthar byed par 'gyur ba 'di ni mchog tu thogs na srid pa bdun zhes bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa bdun du mi dang lha'i nang du nying mtshams sbyar nas sdug bsngal mthar byed par 'gyur ba 'di ni mchog tu thogs na srid pa bdun zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the “maximum of seven rebirths” because one is reborn seven times at most, either among humans or in the heavenly worlds, and then puts an end to suffering.

original: dge slong dag gang gis chos 'di rnams yang dag ba'i shes rab kyis lta bar 'gyur zhing 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug srab mor gyur cing 'jig rten 'dir lan cig 'ongs nas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed par 'gyur ba 'di ni lan cig phyir 'ong🔽ba zhes bya'o //🔽dge slong dag gang gis chos 'di rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi shes rab kyis lta bar 'gyur zhing tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun sbyor lnga spangs shing yongs su shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong dag gang gis chos 'di rnams yang dag ba'i shes rab kyis lta bar 'gyur zhing 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug srab mor gyur cing 'jig rten 'dir lan cig 'ongs nas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed par 'gyur ba 'di ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya'o // dge slong dag gang gis chos 'di rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi shes rab kyis lta bar 'gyur zhing tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun sbyor lnga spangs shing yongs su shes par 'gyur te /
translated: “Monks, one who sees these phenomena in this way with right wisdom, and whose passion, hatred, and delusion have become feeble, will put an end to suffering in this very life. This is called a ‘once-returner.’

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “Monks, one who sees these phenomena in this way with right wisdom, and who has abandoned and fully understood the five lower fetters,🔽will be reborn in a pure world and will attain final nirvāṇa there.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom mo /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom mo /
translated: The five are the afflicted view of the self, desire for pleasure, malice, clinging to rules and ritual as supreme, and doubt.

original: 'di ni skyes nas der mya ngan las 'das te /
analyzed: 'di ni skyes nas der mya ngan las 'das te /
translated: Having been born there, he attains nirvana.

original: 'jig rten 'dir phyir mi ldog pa'i chos can phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dir phyir mi ldog pa'i chos can phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called a non-returner who does not return to this world.

original: dge slong dag gang gis chos 'di rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi shes rab kyis shin tu mthong bar 'gyur pa ni nye bar len pa med par zag pa dag las sems rnam par bral zhing grol bar gyur pa /🔽bya ba byas pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag gang gis chos 'di rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi shes rab kyis shin tu mthong bar 'gyur pa ni nye bar len pa med par zag pa dag las sems rnam par bral zhing grol bar gyur pa / bya ba byas pa /
translated: Monks, he who sees these phenomena as they are with wisdom, his mind is freed from defilements without grasping.

original: khur bor ba /
analyzed: khur bor ba /
translated: He has done what must be done.🔽He has laid down the burden.

original: rang gi don rjes su thob pa /
analyzed: rang gi don rjes su thob pa /
translated: He has attained his own goal.

original: srid pa kun tu sbyor ba yongs su zad pa /
analyzed: srid pa kun tu sbyor ba yongs su zad pa /
translated: The fetters of existence are completely exhausted.

original: yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis sems rnam par grol bar gyur to zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis sems rnam par grol bar gyur to zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: His mind is liberated by right wisdom.

original: dge slong dag chos gcig mngon par shes shing yongs su ma shes na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge slong dag chos gcig mngon par shes shing yongs su ma shes na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Monks, if one thing is not directly known and fully understood...

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting was in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag thams cad mngon par shes shing yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs bstan par bya yis legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung shig dang / bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag thams cad mngon par shes shing yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs bstan par bya yis legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung shig dang / bshad par bya'o //
translated: Monks, I will teach a Dharma discourse called The Directly Knowing and Fully Understanding All. Listen well and keep it in mind. I will explain it.

original: thams cad mngon par shes shing yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs gang zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad mngon par shes shing yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Dharma discourse called The Directly Knowing and Fully Understanding All?

original: dge slong dag mig mngon par shes shing yongs su shes te /
analyzed: dge slong dag mig mngon par shes shing yongs su shes te /
translated: Monks, the eye is directly known and fully understood.

original: gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba dang / @19b sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa de dag kyang mngon par shes shing yongs su shes so //
analyzed: gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba dang / @19b sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa de dag kyang mngon par shes shing yongs su shes so //
translated: He has direct knowledge of and full understanding of form, eye consciousness, eye contact, and the pleasant, unpleasant, or neither unpleasant nor pleasant feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact.

original: bram ze lta ba la chags pa dang / zhen pa @23b dang ; 'brel pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa dang / yang dag par chags pa'i rgyus rab tu byung ba dang rab tu byung ba rnams lhan cig rtsod par gyur to //

translated: “Brahmin, it is due to the causes and conditions of attachment to views, of clinging to views, of being bound by views, of being obsessed with views, and of being utterly attached to views that those who have gone forth quarrel with those who have gone forth.”

original: k'a ty'a ya na lta ba la chags pa dang / zhen pa dang / 'brel ba dang / mngon par 'dod pa dang / yang dag par chags pa'i rgyus rab tu byung ba rnams rtsod par gyur na /

translated: “Kātyāyana, if those who have gone forth quarrel due to the causes and conditions of attachment to views,

original: k'a ty'a ya na da ltar kha cig 'dod pa la chags pa dang / zhen pa dang / 'brel pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa dang / yang dag par chags pa'i rgyu 'di dag las yang dag par 'das pa dang / lta ba la chags pa dang /

original: zhen pa dang / 'brel pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa dang / yang dag par chags pa'i rgyu 'di dag las 'das pa yod dam /
analyzed: zhen pa dang / 'brel pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa dang / yang dag par chags pa'i rgyu 'di dag las 'das pa yod dam /

original: bram ze yod de /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: lta ba la chags pa dang / zhen pa dang / 'brel pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa dang / yang dag par chags pa'i rgyu 'di dag las yang dag par 'das so //
analyzed: lta ba la chags pa dang / zhen pa dang / 'brel pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa dang / yang dag par chags pa'i rgyu 'di dag las yang dag par 'das so //

analyzed: k'a ty'a ya na bcom ldan 'das goo ta ma da ltar gang na bzhugs /

translated: Blessed One, homage to the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One,🔽who has completely transcended these causes of attachment, clinging, bondage, strong desire, and complete entanglement in views,

translated: and has completely transcended attachment, clinging, bondage, strong desire, and complete entanglement in views.🔽Homage to him!

original: phyag 'tshal lo zhes ched du brjod do //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal lo zhes ched du brjod do //
translated: Homage to him!

original: de nas bram ze dbyug pa can tshe dang ldan pa k'a ty'a ya chen pos bshad pa la rjes su yi rang zhing mngon par dga' nas stan las langs te song ngo //
analyzed: de nas bram ze dbyug pa can tshe dang ldan pa k'a ty'a ya chen pos bshad pa la rjes su yi rang zhing mngon par dga' nas stan las langs te song ngo //
translated: Then the brahmin Daṇḍapāṇi, having rejoiced in and delighted in the teaching of the Venerable Mahākātyāyana, rose from his seat and departed.

analyzed: de nyid mdo la brten te slob dpon sna tshogs blo gros gyis tshigs su bcad pa bzhi brgya pa las bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa /
translated: Bhagavān in reliance on sūtra:

original: 'dod pa mi snang 'brel med cing //
analyzed: 'dod pa mi snang 'brel med cing //
translated: Desire does not appear, is not related,

original: lta ba'i dra ba bcom gyur pa //
analyzed: lta ba'i dra ba bcom gyur pa //
translated: and the net of views is destroyed.

original: de nas rtsod rtsa mi 'byung ste //🔽rtsa ba med par gang las 'byung //
analyzed: de nas rtsod rtsa mi 'byung ste // rtsa ba med par gang las 'byung //

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: from what rootless thing does it arise?🔽The Sūtra on the Two Comprehensives states:🔽“Men and women are mutually attracted to each other’s form.”

original: pho dang mo dag phan tshun gzugs la mngon par dga'o zhes bya ba la re rer bsdus pa las bsdus pa'i sdom gnyis pa'i mtha'i mdo las 'byung ste /
analyzed: pho dang mo dag phan tshun gzugs la mngon par dga'o zhes bya ba la re rer bsdus pa las bsdus pa'i sdom gnyis pa'i mtha'i mdo las 'byung ste /
translated: This is stated in the sūtra in terms of each being included in the other.

original: de las 'di skad du 'don te /
analyzed: de las 'di skad du 'don te /
translated: The sūtra states:

original: dge slong dag ji ltar skyes bu bud med la chags pa las 'di ltar dga' ba skye ba /
analyzed: dge slong dag ji ltar skyes bu bud med la chags pa las 'di ltar dga' ba skye ba /
translated: “Monks, just as a man is attached to a woman, in this way joy arises.

original: 'di ltar rgyags pa dang / sred pa dang / dga' ba dang / chags pa dang / brgyal ba dang / 'ching ba dang / don du gnyer ba dang ; kun tu sbyor ba'i chos gcig kyang ngas yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyags pa dang / sred pa dang / dga' ba dang / chags pa dang / brgyal ba dang / 'ching ba dang / don du gnyer ba dang ; kun tu sbyor ba'i chos gcig kyang ngas yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
translated: In this way, I do not see any single phenomenon that is a cause of intoxication, craving, delight, attachment, fainting, bondage, striving, or fettering.

original: skyes bu bud med kyi gzugs la chags pa dang / zhen pa dang / chags zhen dang / brgyal ba dang / zhen pa thob pa ni skyon mi mthong zhing nges par 'byung ba mi tshol bas skyes bu bud med kyi dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu bud med kyi gzugs la chags pa dang / zhen pa dang / chags zhen dang / brgyal ba dang / zhen pa thob pa ni skyon mi mthong zhing nges par 'byung ba mi tshol bas skyes bu bud med kyi dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: A man who is attached to, dependent on, attached and dependent on, who has fainted and is bound to the form of a woman, does not see the faults and does not seek liberation, so he is under the power of the woman.

original: skyes bu bud med kyi gzugs la ji lta ba de bzhin du bud med skyes pa'i gzugs la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: skyes bu bud med kyi gzugs la ji lta ba de bzhin du bud med skyes pa'i gzugs la yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as a man is with regard to the form of a woman, so also a woman is with regard to the form of a man.

original: 'dres pa zhes bya ba'i gsum pa las kyang skyes bu bud med kyi gzugs la bud med kyang skyes bu'i gzugs la ste /
analyzed: 'dres pa zhes bya ba'i gsum pa las kyang skyes bu bud med kyi gzugs la bud med kyang skyes bu'i gzugs la ste /
translated: In the third chapter called “Mixed” it says: A woman is with regard to the form of a man, and a man is with regard to the form of a woman.

original: gzugs ji lta ba de bzhin du @24b dri dang ro dang reg bya gsum la yang mdo rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: gzugs ji lta ba de bzhin du @24b dri dang ro dang reg bya gsum la yang mdo rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Just as with form, there are three types of sutra for smell, taste and tactility.

original: zhing dang sa bon gyi go rims lta bur bstan pa'i don du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhing dang sa bon gyi go rims lta bur bstan pa'i don du zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of the statement “The order of the fields and seeds is taught” is as follows.

original: sa bon gyi rnam pa lnga ste zhes mdo las 'byung ste /
analyzed: sa bon gyi rnam pa lnga ste zhes mdo las 'byung ste /
translated: The sutra mentions five types of seeds.🔽The third verse of the summary in the Sutra on One Dharma states, “I do not see any dharma at all.”

original: bde ba la phung po zhes bya ba las ngas chos gcig kyang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong zhes bya ba'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa las dang / mdzod kyi gnas drug par kun 'byung gi bden pa dpyad pa las ji skad du sa bon gyi rnam par lnga zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes rang gi ngo bos bsdus nas der 'chad par
analyzed: bde ba la phung po zhes bya ba las ngas chos gcig kyang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong zhes bya ba'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa las dang / mdzod kyi gnas drug par kun 'byung gi bden pa dpyad pa las ji skad du sa bon gyi rnam par lnga zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes rang gi ngo bos bsdus nas der 'chad par
translated: And in the sixth chapter of the Abhidharmakośa, in the analysis of the truth of origin, it says, “The five types of seeds are synonyms for consciousness associated with appropriation.”

original: 'gyur ro // chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong ji skad du bshad ce na /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong ji skad du bshad ce na /
translated: How are the eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma explained?

original: ji ltar ched du brjod pa bsdus pa las dang po'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa'i mdo las 'byung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar ched du brjod pa bsdus pa las dang po'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa'i mdo las 'byung ste /
translated: As the Collection of Aphorisms says:

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos smras pa /
translated: The venerable Ananda said:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gis chos kyi phung po brgyad khri lhag cig bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du thos shing bzung la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gis chos kyi phung po brgyad khri lhag cig bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du thos shing bzung la /
translated: Venerable ones, I have heard and retained more than eighty thousand dharmas from the Bhagavat.

original: gnyis ni dge slong dag las so //
analyzed: gnyis ni dge slong dag las so //
translated: Two were from the bhikshus.

original: bdag gi tshig dum bur bzung ba ni yang dag par rjes su mi dran te /
analyzed: bdag gi tshig dum bur bzung ba ni yang dag par rjes su mi dran te /
translated: I do not recall the words of those I have heard in pieces.

original: gzhan du na dus gcig tu thos so //
analyzed: gzhan du na dus gcig tu thos so //
translated: Rather, I heard them all at once.

original: bcom ldan 'das la yongs su dris te bzung ba ni bdag gis mngon par mi shes te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la yongs su dris te bzung ba ni bdag gis mngon par mi shes te /
translated: I do not know the Bhagavat's teachings that I have asked others to retain.

original: gzhan du na lan cig thos pas so //
analyzed: gzhan du na lan cig thos pas so //
translated: Rather, I heard them once.

original: de'i tshe yang 'di lta bu ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang 'di lta bu ste /
translated: At that time, it was like this.

original: 'di ltar sems kyi chos yongs su gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems kyi chos yongs su gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the dharmas of the mind should be retained.

original: kha cig chos kyi rjes su bzung zhing rtogs pa thob pa dang / gzhan yongs su gzung ba'i phyir zhes mngon par mi shes te /
analyzed: kha cig chos kyi rjes su bzung zhing rtogs pa thob pa dang / gzhan yongs su gzung ba'i phyir zhes mngon par mi shes te /
translated: Some do not understand that the Buddha has accepted the Dharma and attained realization, and that he has accepted others.

original: gzhan du na bdag nyid gdul ba'i don dang / zhi ba'i don dang / bdag nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na bdag nyid gdul ba'i don dang / zhi ba'i don dang / bdag nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i don du'o //
translated: Otherwise, he would have been intent on his own training, on his own peace, and on his own nirvana.

original: sems khengs pa dang zhum pa'i rgyu yang dag par rjes su mi shes so //
analyzed: sems khengs pa dang zhum pa'i rgyu yang dag par rjes su mi shes so //
translated: He does not understand the causes of mental inflation and depression.

original: tshangs par spyod pa gzhan las lhag pa'i rgyu'i sems mngon par mi shes shing ma skyes so //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa gzhan las lhag pa'i rgyu'i sems mngon par mi shes shing ma skyes so //
translated: He does not understand the mind that is the cause of the superiority of his pure conduct.

original: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di ltar bshad pa na tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo chos la ngo mtshar bar gyur to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di ltar bshad pa na tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo chos la ngo mtshar bar gyur to //
translated: When the Venerable Ananda explained this, the Venerable Nanda was amazed at the Dharma.

original: de la re zhig lnga ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la re zhig lnga ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the five, etc.,

original: tshul khrims la sogs @25a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs @25a * //
translated: the aggregates of morality, etc.,

original: pa'i phung po de dang de las 'don pa bzhin te /
analyzed: pa'i phung po de dang de las 'don pa bzhin te /
translated: are like the extracts.

original: ji ltar re zhig drug pa'i mdo'i gsum tshan gyi dang po las ji skad bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji ltar re zhig drug pa'i mdo'i gsum tshan gyi dang po las ji skad bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is like the first of the three sets of six in the Ṣat-pāramitā-upadeśa-śāstra.

original: chos lnga mngon sum du bya ba ni mi slob pa'i phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: chos lnga mngon sum du bya ba ni mi slob pa'i phung po lnga ste /
translated: The five phenomena that are directly perceived are the five aggregates of the nonlearner.

original: mi slob pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po'o //
translated: They are the aggregate of morality, the aggregate of samādhi, the aggregate of wisdom, the aggregate of liberation, and the aggregate of the vision of the wisdom of liberation.

original: zad par gyi skye mched bcu po rnams ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zad par gyi skye mched bcu po rnams ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The ten bases of totality

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting was in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag zad par gyi skye mched ni bcu po 'di rnams te /
analyzed: dge slong dag zad par gyi skye mched ni bcu po 'di rnams te /
translated: “Monks, the bases of totality are these ten.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: la la zad par sa'o zhes steng dang 'og dang thad kar gnyis su med cing tshad med par 'du shes su byed cing la la zad par chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang /
analyzed: la la zad par sa'o zhes steng dang 'og dang thad kar gnyis su med cing tshad med par 'du shes su byed cing la la zad par chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang /
translated: Some cultivate the perception of the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the blue element, the yellow element, the red element,

original: dkar po dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang ; rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched do zhes steng dang 'og dang thad kar gnyis su med cing tshad med par 'du shes su byed do zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: dkar po dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang ; rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched do zhes steng dang 'og dang thad kar gnyis su med cing tshad med par 'du shes su byed do zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: the white element, the sphere of infinite space, and the sphere of infinite consciousness as infinite above, below, and across, without limit, without distinction.”

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The bases of overpowering are also like that.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting was in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag brgyad po 'di dag ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched de /
analyzed: dge slong dag brgyad po 'di dag ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched de /
translated: “Monks, there are eight bases of overpowering.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung ngu kha dog bzang po'am ngan pa rnams la lta zhing gzugs de dag zil gyi sa mnan nas shes /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung ngu kha dog bzang po'am ngan pa rnams la lta zhing gzugs de dag zil gyi sa mnan nas shes /
translated: With the perception of no inner form, they see small outer forms, beautiful or ugly, and they know those forms to be overcome.

original: gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas mthong ste /
analyzed: gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas mthong ste /
translated: They see those forms to be overcome.

original: de lta bu'i 'du shes su gyur pa 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang po'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'du shes su gyur pa 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang po'o //
translated: This kind of perception is the first sense field of mastery.

original: nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chen po kha dog bzang po dang ngan pa rnams la lta zhing gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes /
analyzed: nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chen po kha dog bzang po dang ngan pa rnams la lta zhing gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes /
translated: With the perception of inner form, they see large outer forms, beautiful or ugly, and they know those forms to be overcome.

original: zil gyis mnan nas mthong ste /
analyzed: zil gyis mnan nas mthong ste /
translated: They see those forms to be overcome.

original: de lta bu'i 'du shes par gyur pa 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'du shes par gyur pa 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gnyis pa'o //
translated: This kind of perception is the second sense field of mastery.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung ngu kha dog bzang po dang ngan pa rnams la lta zhing gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung ngu kha dog bzang po dang ngan pa rnams la lta zhing gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes /
translated: With the perception of no inner form, they see small outer forms, beautiful or ugly, and they know those forms to be overcome.

original: zil gyis @25b mnan nas mthong ste /
analyzed: zil gyis @25b mnan nas mthong ste /
translated: He sees them having overwhelmed them.

original: de lta bur 'du shes par gyur pa 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur 'du shes par gyur pa 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third overpoweringsphere.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chen po kha dog bzang po dang / ngan pa rnams la lta zhing gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chen po kha dog bzang po dang / ngan pa rnams la lta zhing gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes /
translated: With the perception of the absence of form internally, he sees external forms that are large, beautiful, and ugly.

original: zil gyis mnan nas mthong ste /
analyzed: zil gyis mnan nas mthong ste /
translated: He sees them having overwhelmed them.

original: de lta bur 'du shes par 'gyur pa 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur 'du shes par 'gyur pa 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth overpoweringsphere.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs sngon po kha dog sngon po sngon po lta bur ston pa 'od sngon po 'byung ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs sngon po kha dog sngon po sngon po lta bur ston pa 'od sngon po 'byung ba 'di lta ste /
translated: With the perception of the absence of form internally, he sees external forms that are blue, of blue color, of blue luster.

original: zar ma'i me tog gam /
analyzed: zar ma'i me tog gam /
translated: Just as a flax flower🔽that is blue, of blue color, of blue luster.

original: yul w'a r'a na s'i'i ras phan sum tshogs pa sngon po kha dog sngon po sngon po lta bur ston pa 'od sngon po 'byung ba de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs sngon po kha dog sngon po lta bur ston pa
analyzed: yul w'a r'a na s'i'i ras phan sum tshogs pa sngon po kha dog sngon po sngon po lta bur ston pa 'od sngon po 'byung ba de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs sngon po kha dog sngon po lta bur ston pa
translated: Just as a cloth from Vārāṇasī is blue, has a blue color, appears as blue, and shines with blue light, in the same way, with the perception of no inner form, one sees external blue forms, blue in color, appearing as blue,

original: 'od sngon po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'od sngon po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched lnga pa'o //
translated: shining with blue light. This is the fifth base of overpowering.🔽With the perception of no inner form, one sees external yellow forms, yellow in color, appearing as yellow,

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs ser po kha dog ser po ser po lta bur ston pa 'od ser po 'byung ba 'di lta ste /🔽dong ka'i me tog gam /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs ser po kha dog ser po ser po lta bur ston pa 'od ser po 'byung ba 'di lta ste / dong ka'i me tog gam /
translated: shining with yellow light, just as

original: yul w'a r'a na s'i'i ras phun sum tshogs pa ser po kha dog ser po ser po lta bur ston pa 'od ser po 'byung ba de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs ser po kha dog ser po ser po lta bur
analyzed: yul w'a r'a na s'i'i ras phun sum tshogs pa ser po kha dog ser po ser po lta bur ston pa 'od ser po 'byung ba de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs ser po kha dog ser po ser po lta bur
translated: a kanaka flower or a cloth from Vārāṇasī is yellow, has a yellow color, appears as yellow, and shines with yellow light. In the same way, with the perception of no inner form, one sees external yellow forms, yellow in color, appearing as yellow,🔽shining with yellow light.

original: ston pa 'od ser po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched drug pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa 'od ser po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth sphere of mastery.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs dmar po kha dog dmar po dmar po lta bur ston pa 'od dmar po 'byung ba 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs dmar po kha dog dmar po dmar po lta bur ston pa 'od dmar po 'byung ba 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: “With the perception of no form internally, he sees external forms that are red, the color of red, of a red hue, and shining with a red light.

original: ban du dzi ba ka'i me tog gam /
analyzed: ban du dzi ba ka'i me tog gam /
translated: For example, it is like the bandhujīvaka flower,🔽or it is like excellent cloth from Vārāṇasī, which is red, the color of red, of a red hue, and shining with a red light.

original: yul w'a r'a na s'i'i ras phun sum tshogs pa dmar po kha dog dmar po dmar po lta bur ston pa 'od dmar po 'byung ba de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs dmar po kha dog dmar po dmar po lta bur
analyzed: yul w'a r'a na s'i'i ras phun sum tshogs pa dmar po kha dog dmar po dmar po lta bur ston pa 'od dmar po 'byung ba de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs dmar po kha dog dmar po dmar po lta bur
translated: In the same way, with the perception of no form internally, he sees external forms that are red, the color of red, of a red hue, and shining with a red light.

original: ston pa 'od dmar po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched bdun pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa 'od dmar po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh sphere of mastery.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs dkar po kha dog dkar po dkar po lta bur ston pa 'od dkor po 'byung @26a * //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs dkar po kha dog dkar po dkar po lta bur ston pa 'od dkor po 'byung @26a * //
translated: Having the perception of the internal absence of form, they see external forms that are white, white in color, shining with white light,

original: ba 'di lta ste dper na skar ma pa ba sangs lta bu'am /
analyzed: ba 'di lta ste dper na skar ma pa ba sangs lta bu'am /
translated: such as the star Pūrvaphalgunā,🔽or the excellent cloth of Vārāṇasī that is white, white in color, shining with white light.

original: yul w'a r'a na s'i'i ras phun sum tshogs pa dkar po kha dog dkar po dkar po lta bur ston pa 'od dkar po 'byung ba de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs dkar po kha dog dkar po dkar po lta bur
analyzed: yul w'a r'a na s'i'i ras phun sum tshogs pa dkar po kha dog dkar po dkar po lta bur ston pa 'od dkar po 'byung ba de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs dkar po kha dog dkar po dkar po lta bur
translated: In the same way, having the perception of the internal absence of form, they see external forms that are white, white in color, shining with white light.

original: ston pa 'od dkar po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad pa'o zhes bka' stsal to /
analyzed: ston pa 'od dkar po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad pa'o zhes bka' stsal to /
translated: This is the eighth sphere of mastery.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas la sogs pa skye mched gzhan bzhi po rnams ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas la sogs pa skye mched gzhan bzhi po rnams ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The four other spheres, such as the sphere of infinite space, are as follows.

original: gling gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gling gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The foundation is in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag skye mched ni bzhi po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag skye mched ni bzhi po 'di dag ste /
translated: Monks, there are four spheres.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skya mched dang 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched do zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skya mched dang 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched do zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness, and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: skye mched 'di dag ni gnyis pa'i de ma thag mdo'i dum bu rnam par dbye ba las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched 'di dag ni gnyis pa'i de ma thag mdo'i dum bu rnam par dbye ba las blta bar bya'o //
translated: These spheres should be understood in detail from the sutra passage on the second absorption.

original: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched lnga po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched lnga po zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five spheres of mastery

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting was at Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag rnam par grol ba'i skye mched ni lnga ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag rnam par grol ba'i skye mched ni lnga ste /
translated: Monks, there are five spheres of mastery.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: dge slong dag 'di la ston pa'am tshangs par spyod pa mkhas pa bla ma'i gnas lta bu gzhan gang yang rung ba chos ston par byed de //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di la ston pa'am tshangs par spyod pa mkhas pa bla ma'i gnas lta bu gzhan gang yang rung ba chos ston par byed de //
translated: Monks, here the Teacher or a wise fellow student, who is a good and virtuous friend, teaches the Dharma.

original: ji lta ji ltar ston pa'am tshangs par spyod pa bla ma'i gnas lta bu gzhan gang yang rung ba chos ston par byed pa de lta de ltar chos rnams don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar ston pa'am tshangs par spyod pa bla ma'i gnas lta bu gzhan gang yang rung ba chos ston par byed pa de lta de ltar chos rnams don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: As the Dharma is taught by the teacher or by some other person who is like a teacher, such as a brahman, in just that way, the Dharma is understood through the discernment of meaning and the discernment of phenomena.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa de la chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa de la chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “The discernment of meaning gives rise to joy in the discernment of phenomena.

original: dga' ba de la rab tu dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' ba de la rab tu dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “That joy gives rise to delight.

original: yid dga' na lus shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid dga' na lus shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: “When the mind is delighted, the body becomes tranquil.

original: lus shin tu sbyangs na bde ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs na bde ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “When the body is tranquil, one experiences happiness.

original: bde ba myong na ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba myong na ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: “When one experiences happiness, one’s mind becomes concentrated.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa na ji lta ba bzhin shes pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa na ji lta ba bzhin shes pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “When the mind is concentrated, one knows and sees things as they really are.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong na skyo @26b bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong na skyo @26b bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one knows and sees things as they really are, one will become disenchanted.

original: skyon 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyon 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is disenchanted, one will become free from desire.

original: 'dod chags dang bral na grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral na grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is free from desire, one will be liberated.

original: 'di ni rnam par grol ba'i skye mched dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par grol ba'i skye mched dang po'o //
translated: This is the first source of liberation.

original: gang las dge slong ngam dge slong ma de'i dran pa nye bar mi gnas pa dran pa nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang las dge slong ngam dge slong ma de'i dran pa nye bar mi gnas pa dran pa nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: “If a monk or nun is not mindful, they will become mindful.

original: sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur /
translated: If their mind is not in equipoise, it will enter equipoise.

original: zag pa yongs su ma zad pa yongs su zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zag pa yongs su ma zad pa yongs su zad par 'gyur te /
translated: If their outflows have not yet ended, they will end them.

original: rjes su ma thob pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa grub pa dang bde ba bla na med pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su ma thob pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa grub pa dang bde ba bla na med pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: They will attain the nirvāṇa that they have not yet attained, and they will attain the unsurpassed bliss.

original: gzhan yang dge slong ston pa'am tshangs par spyod pa mkhas pa bla ma'i gnas lta bu gzhan gang yang rung ba chos ston par mi byed mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong ston pa'am tshangs par spyod pa mkhas pa bla ma'i gnas lta bu gzhan gang yang rung ba chos ston par mi byed mod kyi /
translated: “Moreover, even if a monk, a teacher, or a wise practitioner of pure conduct, or anyone else who is like a spiritual teacher, does not teach the Dharma,

original: ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar mthong ba dang thob pa'i chos rnams rgyas par kha ton byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar mthong ba dang thob pa'i chos rnams rgyas par kha ton byed de /
translated: He recites the teachings that he has heard, seen, and attained in detail.

original: ji lta ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar mthong ba dang / rtogs pa'i chos rnams rgyas par kha ton du byed pa de lta de ltar chos rnams la don so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur ro //🔽chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa de la chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang don so so yang dag par rig pa'i dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar mthong ba dang / rtogs pa'i chos rnams rgyas par kha ton du byed pa de lta de ltar chos rnams la don so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur ro // chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa de la chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang don so so yang dag par rig pa'i dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As he recites the teachings that he has heard, seen, and realized in detail, he gains the analytical knowledge of the teachings.🔽He gains the analytical knowledge of the meaning. He experiences joy and happiness based on the analytical knowledge of the teachings and the analytical knowledge of the meaning.

original: dga' ba da la rab tu dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ba nas 'dod chags dang bral ba dang grol ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: dga' ba da la rab tu dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ba nas 'dod chags dang bral ba dang grol ba'i bar du ste /
translated: He experiences the joy and happiness that come from the analytical knowledge of the teachings and the analytical knowledge of the meaning.

original: 'di ni rnam par grol ba'i skye mched gnyis pa'o //
