translated: Therefore, from where does the phrase “in the stage with investigation and analysis” come?

original: bye brag tu bshad pa las so //🔽rtog pa med par brjod par bya //
analyzed: bye brag tu bshad pa las so // rtog pa med par brjod par bya //
translated: It comes from the great treatise.

original: zhes bya ba gang nas 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gang nas 'byung zhe na /
translated: From where does the phrase “without investigation” come?

original: chos mngon pa las so //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las so //
translated: It comes from the Abhidharma.

original: mdo las 'byung ba rnams ni gzhi nyid dang / sra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gzung ba'i phyir la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo las 'byung ba rnams ni gzhi nyid dang / sra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gzung ba'i phyir la zhes bya ba la /
translated: The sūtras state that the four great elements are the basis and are grasped as having the characteristics of solidity and so on.

original: lung bar ma'i 'dun pa'i mjug thogs su glang po che'i rjes lta bu'i mdo de dang der ji ltar re zhig gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: lung bar ma'i 'dun pa'i mjug thogs su glang po che'i rjes lta bu'i mdo de dang der ji ltar re zhig gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
translated: “What is form, the appropriated aggregates?

original: gzugs gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi rgyur byas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi rgyur byas pa'o //
translated: Whatever form there is, all of that is the four great elements and form derived from the four great elements.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four great elements?

original: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams so //
analyzed: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams so //
translated: The earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element.

original: sa'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: sa'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the earth element?

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag sa'i khams ni gnyis te /🔽nang gi bdag nyid dang / phyi rol gyi ste ;
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag sa'i khams ni gnyis te / nang gi bdag nyid dang / phyi rol gyi ste ;
translated: Venerable ones, the earth element is twofold:🔽the internal and the external.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi sa'i khams dang phyi rol gyi'o //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi sa'i khams dang phyi rol gyi'o //
translated: The internal earth element and the external earth element.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi sa'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi sa'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the internal earth element?🔽Whatever in this body is hard, solid, and appropriated.

original: gang lus 'di la nang gi bdag nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas phyi'i bar du ste /
analyzed: gang lus 'di la nang gi bdag nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas phyi'i bar du ste /
translated: Up to:

original: rlung dang rlung du gyur pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rlung dang rlung du gyur pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “wind and what is made of wind” up to “this is the external wind element.”

original: 'di ni phyi'i rlung gi khams so zhes bya ba'i bar du ji ltar khams drug rnams par dbye ba'i mdo'i rjes thogs kho nar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phyi'i rlung gi khams so zhes bya ba'i bar du ji ltar khams drug rnams par dbye ba'i mdo'i rjes thogs kho nar blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in the same way as the Sūtra on the Analysis of the Six Elements.

original: mdo las ji skad du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo las ji skad du zhes bya ba la /
translated: As it is said in the Sūtra:

original: skye mched so sor bstan par sngar bris pa bzhin blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched so sor bstan par sngar bris pa bzhin blta bar bya'o //
translated: The presentation of the sense spheres should be understood as it was written earlier.

original: 'o na gang mig gi sha'i gong bu la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar lag pa brdabs pa'i dpe'i mdor bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'o na gang mig gi sha'i gong bu la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar lag pa brdabs pa'i dpe'i mdor bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: “But what is the flesh of the eye?” and so on, is like the example of the hand in the Sūtra on the Miracle of the Hand.

original: dge slong dag skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge slong dag skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Monks, this person consists of six elements.”

original: bcom ldan 'das yul ma ga dha na ljongs rgyu zhing rim gyis rgyal ba'i gan du gshegs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yul ma ga dha na ljongs rgyu zhing rim gyis rgyal ba'i gan du gshegs so //
translated: The Blessed One was traveling through the country of Magadha and gradually came to the city of Rājagṛha.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rdza mkhan bha rga gang na ba der nye bar gshegs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rdza mkhan bha rga gang na ba der nye bar gshegs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One went to where the potter Bharadvāja was.

original: nye bar gshegs nas rdza mkhan bha rga la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: nye bar gshegs nas rdza mkhan bha rga la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Having arrived, he said this to the potter Bharadvāja:🔽“Bharadvāja, give me some alms.”

original: bha rga gal te nga khyod la mi gnod na khyod kyi nang khyim gyi phyogs gcig tu nyin zhag gcig gnas so //
analyzed: bha rga gal te nga khyod la mi gnod na khyod kyi nang khyim gyi phyogs gcig tu nyin zhag gcig gnas so //
translated: “If I do not disturb you, potter, I will stay one night in one corner of your house.”

original: lha nyid nga la mi gnod @35a * //
analyzed: lha nyid nga la mi gnod @35a * //
translated: “I am not disturbed by the god,

original: mod kyi / 'di na dge sbyong zhig sngar 'ongs nas nyin zhag gcig gnas so //
analyzed: mod kyi / 'di na dge sbyong zhig sngar 'ongs nas nyin zhag gcig gnas so //
translated: but a certain ascetic came here before and stayed one night.”🔽“If the Venerable One is not disturbed, may he stay as long as he likes and be happy.”

original: gal te tshe dang ldan pa la mi gnod na lha ji ltar dgyes pa bzhin dga' zhing bde bar bzhugs shig / de nas bcom ldan 'das rdza mkhan dha rga'i khyim du gshegs so //
analyzed: gal te tshe dang ldan pa la mi gnod na lha ji ltar dgyes pa bzhin dga' zhing bde bar bzhugs shig / de nas bcom ldan 'das rdza mkhan dha rga'i khyim du gshegs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One went to the house of the potter Bharga.

original: de'i tshe rdza mkhan bha rga'i khyim na tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri sngar 'ongs te nyin zhag gcig gnas so //
analyzed: de'i tshe rdza mkhan bha rga'i khyim na tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri sngar 'ongs te nyin zhag gcig gnas so //
translated: At that time, the Venerable Pukkusa had come to the house of the potter Bharga before and stayed one night.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the Venerable Pukkusa:

original: dge slong gal te nga khyod la mi gnod na rdza mkhan bharga'i khyim gyi phyogs gcig tu nyin zhag gcig gnas so //
analyzed: dge slong gal te nga khyod la mi gnod na rdza mkhan bharga'i khyim gyi phyogs gcig tu nyin zhag gcig gnas so //
translated: “Monk, if I do not disturb you, I will stay one night in one corner of the potter Bharga’s house.”

original: rdza mkhan bha rga la yang lta'o //
analyzed: rdza mkhan bha rga la yang lta'o //
translated: I will also see the potter Bharadvāja.🔽“Venerable, I am not sick. Since the potter Bharadvāja’s house is spacious, I have spread out a straw mat and am staying there. Otherwise, stay as you like.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa bdag la mi gnod de 'di ltar rdza mkhan bha rga'i khang pa rgya che zhing ngas rtsva'i stan bkod nas yod pas der gzhan du na ji ltar bde bar bzhugs shig / de nas bcom ldan 'das khang pa'i phyi rol tu zhabs bkrus te
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa bdag la mi gnod de 'di ltar rdza mkhan bha rga'i khang pa rgya che zhing ngas rtsva'i stan bkod nas yod pas der gzhan du na ji ltar bde bar bzhugs shig / de nas bcom ldan 'das khang pa'i phyi rol tu zhabs bkrus te
translated: Then the Blessed One washed his feet outside the house,

original: khang par gshegs nas rang nyid rtsva'i stan bkod pa'i steng du skyil mo krung bcas nas lus bsrang ste dran pa nye bar gzhag bzhin du bzhugs so //
analyzed: khang par gshegs nas rang nyid rtsva'i stan bkod pa'i steng du skyil mo krung bcas nas lus bsrang ste dran pa nye bar gzhag bzhin du bzhugs so //
translated: entered the house, and sat down cross-legged on the straw mat he had spread out himself, with his body straight, and remained in that state, with mindfulness established.

original: tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri yang khang pa'i phyir rol du rkang pa bkrus nas khang pa'i nang du zhugs nas rtsva'i stan bkod pa'i steng du skyil mo krung bcas te lus drang por bsrang ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri yang khang pa'i phyir rol du rkang pa bkrus nas khang pa'i nang du zhugs nas rtsva'i stan bkod pa'i steng du skyil mo krung bcas te lus drang por bsrang ste /
translated: Venerable Pukkusa Mallaputta also washed his feet outside the house, entered the house, sat down cross-legged on the straw mat,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag bzhin du 'jug go //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag bzhin du 'jug go //
translated: and remained in that state, with his body straight, and mindfulness established.

original: nyin zhag de la bcom ldan 'das dang tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri gang phal cher 'phags pa rnams kyis mi smra ba nyid la gnas te 'dug go //
analyzed: nyin zhag de la bcom ldan 'das dang tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri gang phal cher 'phags pa rnams kyis mi smra ba nyid la gnas te 'dug go //
translated: For the whole of that day and night, the Blessed One and the Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra remained mostly silent.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das mtshan mo'i thun tha ma la 'di lta bur dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das mtshan mo'i thun tha ma la 'di lta bur dgongs te /
translated: Then, in the last watch of the night, the Blessed One thought this:

original: rab tu byung ba 'di 'di ltar zhi bar gnas pa ni shin tu ngo mtshar ro //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba 'di 'di ltar zhi bar gnas pa ni shin tu ngo mtshar ro //
translated: It is truly amazing how this one who has gone forth lives in such peace.

original: gang 'di skad bdag gis rab tu byung ba 'di la khyod kyi stod pa gang yin //
analyzed: gang 'di skad bdag gis rab tu byung ba 'di la khyod kyi stod pa gang yin //
translated: I will ask him: 'What do you praise in this one who has gone forth?

original: gang las rab tu byung /
analyzed: gang las rab tu byung /
translated: From whom did you go forth?

original: gang gi chos la dga' zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi chos la dga' zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: What Dharma do you delight in?'

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra:

original: dge slong khyod kyi ston pa gang /
analyzed: dge slong khyod kyi ston pa gang /
translated: Monk, who is your teacher?

original: gang la brten te rab tu byung //
analyzed: gang la brten te rab tu byung //
translated: On whom do you rely to have gone forth?

original: gang gi chos la dga'/
analyzed: gang gi chos la dga'/
translated: What Dharma do you delight in?

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'di na @35b dge sbyong goo ta ma zhes bya ba sh'akya'i sras po sh'akya'i rigs las skra dang kha spu bregs shing ngur smrig bgos nas dad pas yang dag par khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'di na @35b dge sbyong goo ta ma zhes bya ba sh'akya'i sras po sh'akya'i rigs las skra dang kha spu bregs shing ngur smrig bgos nas dad pas yang dag par khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ste /
translated: “Venerable, the ascetic Gautama, the son of the Śākyas, who went forth from the Śākya clan, shaving off his hair and beard and donning saffron robes, has gone forth from the household life into homelessness with true faith,

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bcom ldan 'das de bdag gi ston pa yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bcom ldan 'das de bdag gi ston pa yin no //
translated: and has awakened to supreme, perfect enlightenment. He is my teacher.

original: bdag de las rab tu byung zhing de'i chos la dga'o //
analyzed: bdag de las rab tu byung zhing de'i chos la dga'o //
translated: I have gone forth in his doctrine and delight in his teachings.

original: dge slong khyod kyis snyon par mthong zhing ngo zhes sam //
analyzed: dge slong khyod kyis snyon par mthong zhing ngo zhes sam //
translated: ” “Monk, did you see him and recognize him?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: “Venerable, I did not.”

original: gzhan du na bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang rkang par ldan pa bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: gzhan du na bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang rkang par ldan pa bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: “But rather, the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, the one with insight and conduct, the Sugata,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
translated: the knower of the world,

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /
translated: the incomparable charioteer of those who need taming,

original: skyes bu 'dul zhing kha lo sgyur ba /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul zhing kha lo sgyur ba /
translated: the teacher of gods and humans,🔽the Buddha, the Blessed One, is my teacher.

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so zhes thos so //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so zhes thos so //
translated: the Buddha, the Blessed One, the Teacher of gods and men.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought:

original: rigs kyi bu 'di bdag gi bstan pa la rab tu byung bas bdag gis 'di la chos bshad par bya'o snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di bdag gi bstan pa la rab tu byung bas bdag gis 'di la chos bshad par bya'o snyam du dgongs te /
translated: “This son of noble family has gone forth in my teaching, so I shall explain the Dharma to him.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: He said to the Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra:

original: dge slong thog mar dge ba /🔽bar du dge ba /
analyzed: dge slong thog mar dge ba / bar du dge ba /
translated: “Monk, I will teach the Dharma discourse called The Analysis of the Six Elements, which is virtuous in the beginning,🔽virtuous in the middle,

original: tha mar dge ba /🔽don bzang po ;
analyzed: tha mar dge ba / don bzang po ;
translated: and virtuous in the end,🔽with its own meaning,

original: tshig 'bru bzang po /
analyzed: tshig 'bru bzang po /
translated: with its own phrasing,

original: ma 'dres pa /🔽yongs su rdzogs pa /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa / yongs su rdzogs pa /
translated: unmixed,🔽complete,🔽pure,

original: yongs su dag pa /🔽tshangs par spyod pa /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa / tshangs par spyod pa /
translated: and fully purified.🔽It is a teaching of the pure life.

original: gsal bar byed pa /🔽'di lta ste khams drug rab tu rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs bstan par bya'i /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa / 'di lta ste khams drug rab tu rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs bstan par bya'i /
translated: It is as follows:

original: de legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad par bya'o //
translated: Listen well and keep it in mind, and I will explain it.”

original: khams drug rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs gang zhe na /
analyzed: khams drug rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Dharma instruction called Distinguishing the Six Elements?

original: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa yin te /
translated: “Monks, this person consists of six elements.

original: gang las yid zag pa med pa nye bar mi 'jug pa reg pa'i skye mched drug pa dang / yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad pa dang / byin gyi rlabs bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: gang las yid zag pa med pa nye bar mi 'jug pa reg pa'i skye mched drug pa dang / yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad pa dang / byin gyi rlabs bzhi pa yin no //
translated: From that, the uncontaminated mind does not engage, the six sense bases of contact, the eighteen movements of mind, and the four blessings.

original: zag pa med par 'jug na yid nye bar zhi bas rdzogs par byang chub pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: zag pa med par 'jug na yid nye bar zhi bas rdzogs par byang chub pa zhes brjod do //
translated: When it engages the uncontaminated, it is said to be fully awakened by the pacification of mind.

original: de la 'di ni gdams pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'di ni gdams pa ste /
translated: Here is the instruction:

original: shes rab bag med pa las bsrung ba dang / stong pa rab tu spel ba dang / lam bsgom @36a * //🔽pa pa sten pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab bag med pa las bsrung ba dang / stong pa rab tu spel ba dang / lam bsgom @36a * // pa pa sten pa ste /
translated: Protecting wisdom from carelessness, increasing emptiness, and cultivating the path.

original: 'di ni khams drug rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs kyi mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni khams drug rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs kyi mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the brief teaching of the Dharma instruction Distinguishing the Six Elements.

original: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes bstan pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa cung zad brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes bstan pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa cung zad brjod par bya ste /
translated: The explanation of “Monks, this person consists of six elements” should be briefly stated.

original: khams drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: khams drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six elements?

original: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya ba ste /
translated: They are the earth element, water element, fire element, wind element, space element, and consciousness element.

original: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes bstan pa de ngas rgyas par rab tu bshad do //
analyzed: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes bstan pa de ngas rgyas par rab tu bshad do //
translated: “Monks, this person is made up of six elements” is the teaching I have given in brief.

original: skyes bu 'di ni reg pa'i skye mched drug pa yin no zhes bstan pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa cung zad cig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: skyes bu 'di ni reg pa'i skye mched drug pa yin no zhes bstan pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa cung zad cig brjod par bya ste /
translated: I will now explain a little about the teaching that “this person is made up of six bases of contact.”

original: reg pa'i skye mched drug gang zhen gzugs mthong ba'i phyir mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas /
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched drug gang zhen gzugs mthong ba'i phyir mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas /
translated: What are the six bases of contact? They are eye contact, which is for the purpose of seeing forms,

original: rna ba dang / sgra dang / sna dang / dri dang / lce dang / ro dang / lus dang / reg bya ste /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sgra dang / sna dang / dri dang / lce dang / ro dang / lus dang / reg bya ste /
translated: ear contact, which is for the purpose of hearing sounds, nose contact, which is for the purpose of smelling smells, tongue contact, which is for the purpose of tasting tastes, body contact, which is for the purpose of feeling touchables,

original: chos shes pa'i phyir yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: chos shes pa'i phyir yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du ste /
translated: and mind contact, which is for the purpose of knowing mental objects.

original: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni reg pa'i skye mched drug yin no zhes bstan pa de ngas rgyas par bshad do //
analyzed: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni reg pa'i skye mched drug yin no zhes bstan pa de ngas rgyas par bshad do //
translated: I have explained in detail the statement, “Monks, this person is the six bases of contact.”

original: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad pa yin no zhes bstan pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa cung zad cig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad pa yin no zhes bstan pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa cung zad cig brjod par bya ste /
translated: I will now explain a little of the detailed explanation of the statement, “Monks, this person is the eighteen movements of mind.”

original: yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eighteen movements of mind?

original: yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug go //
analyzed: yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug go //
translated: Six movements of joy, six movements of sorrow, and six movements of equanimity.

original: yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six movements of joy?

original: dge slong 'di la mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas yid bde ba'i gnas kyi gzugs rnams la nye bar rgyu bar byed do //
analyzed: dge slong 'di la mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas yid bde ba'i gnas kyi gzugs rnams la nye bar rgyu bar byed do //
translated: Monks, when the eye sees forms, one moves toward forms that are the basis for joy.

original: rna ba dang / sgra dang / sna dang / dri dang / lce dang / ro dang / lus dang / reg bya dang / yid kyi chos rnams rnam par shes nas yid bde ba'i gnas kyi chos rnams la nye bar rgyu bar byed do //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sgra dang / sna dang / dri dang / lce dang / ro dang / lus dang / reg bya dang / yid kyi chos rnams rnam par shes nas yid bde ba'i gnas kyi chos rnams la nye bar rgyu bar byed do //
translated: ear, sound, nose, smell, tongue, taste, body, touch, and mind, and mental objects.

original: yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six kinds of unpleasant mental activities?

original: dge slong 'di la mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas yid mi bde ba'i gnas kyi gzugs rnams la nye bar rgyu bar byed do //
analyzed: dge slong 'di la mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas yid mi bde ba'i gnas kyi gzugs rnams la nye bar rgyu bar byed do //
translated: When a monk sees forms with his eyes, he is attracted to pleasant forms and repulsed by unpleasant forms.

original: rna ba dang / sgra dang / sna dang / dri dang / lce dang / @36b ro dang / lus dang / reg bya dang / yid kyi chos rnams rnam par shes nas yid mi bde ba'i gnas kyi chos rnams la nye bar rgyu bar byed do //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sgra dang / sna dang / dri dang / lce dang / @36b ro dang / lus dang / reg bya dang / yid kyi chos rnams rnam par shes nas yid mi bde ba'i gnas kyi chos rnams la nye bar rgyu bar byed do //
translated: He is attracted to sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and mental objects, and repulsed by unpleasant mental objects.

original: btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six kinds of neutral mental activities?

original: dge slong 'di la mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas btang snyoms kyi gnas kyi gzugs rnams la nye bar rgyu bar byed do //
analyzed: dge slong 'di la mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas btang snyoms kyi gnas kyi gzugs rnams la nye bar rgyu bar byed do //
translated: “Monks, when this monk sees forms with his eyes, he engages with forms that are objects of indifference.

original: rna ba dang / sgra dang / sna dang / dri dang / lce dang / ro dang / lus dang / reg bya dang / yid kyi chos rnams rnam par shes nas btang snyoms kyi gnas kyi chos rnams la nye bar rgyu bar byed do //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sgra dang / sna dang / dri dang / lce dang / ro dang / lus dang / reg bya dang / yid kyi chos rnams rnam par shes nas btang snyoms kyi gnas kyi chos rnams la nye bar rgyu bar byed do //
translated: When he hears sounds with his ears, smells scents with his nose, tastes flavors with his tongue, feels touchable things with his body, or is conscious of experiences with his mind, he engages with experiences that are objects of indifference.

original: dge slong de la yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu pa drug dang / yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug po 'di dag gcig tu bsdus na yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong de la yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu pa drug dang / yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug po 'di dag gcig tu bsdus na yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: Monks, when you add the six engagements of the mind that are related to joy, the six engagements of the mind that are related to sorrow, and the six engagements of the mind that are related to indifference, they make eighteen engagements of the mind.

original: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad yin no zhes bstan pa de ngas rgyas par rab tu bshad do //
analyzed: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad yin no zhes bstan pa de ngas rgyas par rab tu bshad do //
translated: Monks, this person’s eighteen engagements of the mind have been explained in detail by me.”

original: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni byin gyi rlabs bzhi pa yin no zhes bstan pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa cung zad brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni byin gyi rlabs bzhi pa yin no zhes bstan pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa cung zad brjod par bya ste /
translated: This is the fourth blessing of the monk.

original: byin gyi rlabs pa zhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs pa zhi gang zhe na /
translated: What is the blessing of wisdom?

original: shes rab kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / gtong ba'i byin gyi rlabs dang / nye bar zhi ba'i byin gyi rlabs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / gtong ba'i byin gyi rlabs dang / nye bar zhi ba'i byin gyi rlabs so //
translated: The blessing of wisdom, the blessing of truth, the blessing of generosity, and the blessing of tranquility.🔽This is the fourth blessing of the monk.

original: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni byin gyi rlabs bzhi pa yin no zhes bstan pa de ngas rgyas par rab tu bshad do //
analyzed: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni byin gyi rlabs bzhi pa yin no zhes bstan pa de ngas rgyas par rab tu bshad do //
translated: This is what I have taught in detail.

original: de la 'di ni gdams pa yin te /
analyzed: de la 'di ni gdams pa yin te /
translated: This is the instruction:🔽Do not be careless about wisdom, protect the truth, increase generosity, and follow the path of liberation.

original: shes rab bag med par mi bya ba dang / bden pa rjes su bsrung bar bya ba dang / gtong ba rab tu spel bar bya ba dang / thar pa'i lam bsten par bya'o zhes bstan pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa cung zad cig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab bag med par mi bya ba dang / bden pa rjes su bsrung bar bya ba dang / gtong ba rab tu spel bar bya ba dang / thar pa'i lam bsten par bya'o zhes bstan pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa cung zad cig brjod par bya ste /
translated: This is what I have taught in detail.

original: dge slong ji ltar na shes rab bag med par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong ji ltar na shes rab bag med par mi bya zhe na /
translated: “Bhikṣus, how should you not be careless with wisdom?

original: dge slong 'di la lus 'di nyid kyi khams la so sor rtog ste /
analyzed: dge slong 'di la lus 'di nyid kyi khams la so sor rtog ste /
translated: Bhikṣus, you should investigate the elements of this very body.

original: lus 'di la sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams yod de zhes so sor rtog go //
analyzed: lus 'di la sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams yod de zhes so sor rtog go //
translated: In this body there are the earth element, the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element.

original: sa'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: sa'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the earth element?

original: dge slong sa'i khams ni rnam par gnyis te /🔽nang gi dang / phyi'i ste /
analyzed: dge slong sa'i khams ni rnam par gnyis te / nang gi dang / phyi'i ste /
translated: Bhikṣus, the earth element is twofold:

original: nang gi sa'i khams kyang yod /
analyzed: nang gi sa'i khams kyang yod /
translated: there is the internal earth element and the external earth element.🔽There is also an internal earth element.

original: @37a * // phyi'i sa'i khams kyang yod do //
analyzed: @37a * // phyi'i sa'i khams kyang yod do //
translated: There is also an external earth element.

original: nang gi sa'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: nang gi sa'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the internal earth element?

original: nang gi bdag nyid sra ba dang / mkhrang bar gyur pa drung du gyur pa zin pa ste /
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid sra ba dang / mkhrang bar gyur pa drung du gyur pa zin pa ste /
translated: The internal earth element is that which is solid and lumpy, internal and appropriated,🔽and that which is also the internal earth element.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / so dang / rdul dang / dri ma dang / sha dang / rus pa dang / rgyus pa dang / rtsa dang / snying dang / glo ba dang / rgyu ma dang / gnye ma dang /
analyzed: skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / so dang / rdul dang / dri ma dang / sha dang / rus pa dang / rgyus pa dang / rtsa dang / snying dang / glo ba dang / rgyu ma dang / gnye ma dang /
translated: hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone marrow, kidney,🔽heart, liver, lungs, intestines, mesentery,

original: pho ba dang / long ka dang / lto ba dang / lgang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pho ba dang / long ka dang / lto ba dang / lgang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: stomach, spleen, excrement, brain, and brain stem.

original: gang yang lus 'di la gzhan yang nang gi bdag nyid sra ba dang / mkhrang bar gyur pa /
analyzed: gang yang lus 'di la gzhan yang nang gi bdag nyid sra ba dang / mkhrang bar gyur pa /
translated: Whatever else there is in this body that is hard, solid, and appropriated,

original: drung du gyur pa zin pa 'di ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi sa'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: drung du gyur pa zin pa 'di ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi sa'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: that is internally clung to, is called the internal earth element.

original: phyi rol gyi sa'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sa'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the external earth element?

original: gang yang phyi rol gyi sra ba dang / mkhrang bar gyur pa drung du ma gyur pa ma zin pa 'di ni phyi rol gyi sa'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang phyi rol gyi sra ba dang / mkhrang bar gyur pa drung du ma gyur pa ma zin pa 'di ni phyi rol gyi sa'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: Whatever is external, hard, solid, not clung to, and not appropriated, that is called the external earth element.

original: dge slong de la nang gi bdag nyid kyi sa'i khams dang / phyi rol gyi sa'i khams de dag gcig tu mdor bsdus pa 'di la khams /
analyzed: dge slong de la nang gi bdag nyid kyi sa'i khams dang / phyi rol gyi sa'i khams de dag gcig tu mdor bsdus pa 'di la khams /
translated: The internal earth element and the external earth element are just the earth element.

original: khams tsam / khams kyi rab tu dbye ba nyid du rig nas /
analyzed: khams tsam / khams kyi rab tu dbye ba nyid du rig nas /
translated: Having understood the mere elements and the classification of the elements,

original: de thams cad bdag gi ma yin /
analyzed: de thams cad bdag gi ma yin /
translated: he sees with the wisdom that is in accordance with reality that all of that is not a self,

original: bdag ma yin /
analyzed: bdag ma yin /
translated: is not a being,🔽and is not a life-force.🔽He is free from desire for the earth element.

original: bdag 'di dag ma yin zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi shes rab kyis mthong nas sa'i khams la 'dod chags dang bral ba 'di ni dge slong shes rab bag yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag 'di dag ma yin zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi shes rab kyis mthong nas sa'i khams la 'dod chags dang bral ba 'di ni dge slong shes rab bag yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called a monk who is wise and heedful.

original: chu'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: chu'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the water element?

original: dge slong chu'i khams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dge slong chu'i khams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Monks, the water element is twofold:

original: nang gi bdag nyid dang / phyi rol gyi'o //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid dang / phyi rol gyi'o //
translated: internal and external.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi chu'i khams kyang yod /
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi chu'i khams kyang yod /
translated: There is the internal water element

original: phyi'i chu'i khams kyang yod do /
analyzed: phyi'i chu'i khams kyang yod do /
translated: and the external water element.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi chu'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi chu'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the internal water element?

original: gang yang lus 'di la nang gi bdag nyid kyi chu'i khams mnyen pa dang / mnyen par gyur pa drung du gyur pa zin pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang lus 'di la nang gi bdag nyid kyi chu'i khams mnyen pa dang / mnyen par gyur pa drung du gyur pa zin pa ste /
translated: Whatever in this body is water, watery, and appropriated and internally perceived as water.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: mchi ma dang / rdul dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / zhag dang / chu ser dang / tshil dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang / rnag dang / khu ba dang / glad pa dang / glad rgyas dang / gci ba zhes bya ba ste gang yang lus 'di la gzhan yang nang gi bdag nyid mnyen pa dang mnyen par gyur pa drung du gyur pa zin pa 'di ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi chu'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mchi ma dang / rdul dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / zhag dang / chu ser dang / tshil dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang / rnag dang / khu ba dang / glad pa dang / glad rgyas dang / gci ba zhes bya ba ste gang yang lus 'di la gzhan yang nang gi bdag nyid mnyen pa dang mnyen par gyur pa drung du gyur pa zin pa 'di ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi chu'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: tears, sweat, mucus, nasal mucus, grease, serum, fat, bile, phlegm, pus, blood, urine, brain, and spinal fluid. Whatever else there is in this body that is soft and watery, moist, liquid, and clung to, that is the internal water element.

original: phyi rol gyi chu'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi chu'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the external water element?

original: gang yang @37b phyi rol gyi chu mnyen pa dang / mnyen par gyur pa /
analyzed: gang yang @37b phyi rol gyi chu mnyen pa dang / mnyen par gyur pa /
translated: Whatever externally is soft and watery,

original: drung ma yin pa ma zin pa 'di ni phyi rol gyi chu'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: drung ma yin pa ma zin pa 'di ni phyi rol gyi chu'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: not clung to, that is the external water element.

original: dge slong de la nang gi bdag nyid kyi chu'i khams dang / phyi rol gyi chu'i khams de dag gcig tu mdor bsdus pa 'di dag la khams /
analyzed: dge slong de la nang gi bdag nyid kyi chu'i khams dang / phyi rol gyi chu'i khams de dag gcig tu mdor bsdus pa 'di dag la khams /
translated: The internal water element and the external water element are just water elements.

original: khams tsam / khams kyi rab tu dbye ba nyid du rig na pa de thams cad bdag gi ma yin /🔽bdag ma yin /
analyzed: khams tsam / khams kyi rab tu dbye ba nyid du rig na pa de thams cad bdag gi ma yin / bdag ma yin /
translated: If one knows that all of this is the element of water, the classification of the element of water, then one sees it as it really is with correct wisdom: ‘This is not mine, this I am not, this is not my self.’🔽The mind becomes free from desire in regard to the element of water.

original: bdag 'di dag ma yin zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi shes rab kyis mthong nas chu'i khams la sems 'dod chags dang bral ba 'di ni dge slong shes rab bag yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag 'di dag ma yin zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi shes rab kyis mthong nas chu'i khams la sems 'dod chags dang bral ba 'di ni dge slong shes rab bag yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called a monk who is wise and heedful.

original: me'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: me'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fire element?

original: dge slong me'i khams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dge slong me'i khams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Monks, the fire element is twofold:

original: nang gi dang phyi rol gyi ste /
analyzed: nang gi dang phyi rol gyi ste /
translated: the internal fire element and the external fire element.

original: nang gi me'i khams kyang yod /
analyzed: nang gi me'i khams kyang yod /
translated: There is an internal fire element.

original: phyi rol gyi me'i khams yang yod do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi me'i khams yang yod do //
translated: There is also an external fire element.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi me'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi me'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the internal fire element?

original: gang yang lus 'di nang gi bdag nyid kyi me dang mer gyur pa dang / dro ba dang / dro bar gyur pa dang / drung du gyur pa zin pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang lus 'di nang gi bdag nyid kyi me dang mer gyur pa dang / dro ba dang / dro bar gyur pa dang / drung du gyur pa zin pa ste /
translated: Whatever in this body is fire, has become fire, is appropriated and grasped,

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: lus 'di la gdung bar byed pa dang / yongs su gdung bar byed pa dang / zos pa dang / 'thungs ba dang / bca' ba dang / myangs pa yang dag par smin par 'gyur zhing 'ju bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba dang ;
analyzed: lus 'di la gdung bar byed pa dang / yongs su gdung bar byed pa dang / zos pa dang / 'thungs ba dang / bca' ba dang / myangs pa yang dag par smin par 'gyur zhing 'ju bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba dang ;
translated: It is that which burns and heats the body, and is counted as that which digests what is eaten, drunk, consumed, and tasted.

original: gang yang lus 'di la gzhan yang nang gi bdag nyid kyi me dang mer gyur pa zin pa 'di ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi me'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang lus 'di la gzhan yang nang gi bdag nyid kyi me dang mer gyur pa zin pa 'di ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi me'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: “Moreover, the fire element is that which is internal, belonging to oneself, and is fire or has become fire.

original: phyi rol gyi me'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi me'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the external fire element?

original: gang yang phyi rol gyi me dang mer gyur pa /
analyzed: gang yang phyi rol gyi me dang mer gyur pa /
translated: It is that which is external, not belonging to oneself, and is fire or has become fire.

original: dro ba dang dro bar gyur pa /
analyzed: dro ba dang dro bar gyur pa /
translated: It is that which is warm or has become warm.

original: drung du ma gyur pa /
analyzed: drung du ma gyur pa /
translated: It is that which is not appropriated and not grasped.

original: ma zin pa 'di ni phyi rol gyi me'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma zin pa 'di ni phyi rol gyi me'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the external fire element.

original: de la dge slong nang gi bdag nyid kyi me'i khams dang phyi rol gyi bdag nyid kyi me'i khams de dag gcig tu mdor bsdus pa 'di la khams /
analyzed: de la dge slong nang gi bdag nyid kyi me'i khams dang phyi rol gyi bdag nyid kyi me'i khams de dag gcig tu mdor bsdus pa 'di la khams /
translated: “The monk who has combined the internal fire element and the external fire element into one thinks about the fire element:

original: khams tsam / khams kyi rab tu dbye ba nyid du rig nas de thams cad bdag gi ma yin /
analyzed: khams tsam / khams kyi rab tu dbye ba nyid du rig nas de thams cad bdag gi ma yin /
translated: Having understood the elements as they are in reality and their classification, he sees with the wisdom that is in accordance with reality that all of them are not the self,

original: bdag ma yin /
analyzed: bdag ma yin /
translated: are not the self’s property,🔽and are not the self’s possession.

original: bdag de dag ma yin zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi shes rab kyis mthong na sa me'i khams las sams 'dod chags dang bral ba 'di ni dge slong shes rab bag yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag de dag ma yin zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi shes rab kyis mthong na sa me'i khams las sams 'dod chags dang bral ba 'di ni dge slong shes rab bag yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The monk who is free from desire for the element of fire is called a monk who is wise and heedful.

original: rlung gi khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: rlung gi khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the wind element?

original: dge slong @38a * //
analyzed: dge slong @38a * //
translated: Monks,

original: rlung gi khams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rlung gi khams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: the wind element is twofold:

original: nang gi dang phyi rol gyi ste /
analyzed: nang gi dang phyi rol gyi ste /
translated: internal and external.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi rlung gi khams kyang yod do //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi rlung gi khams kyang yod do //
translated: There is the wind element that is part of oneself and

original: phyi rol gyi bdag nyid kyi rlung gi khams kyang yod do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bdag nyid kyi rlung gi khams kyang yod do //
translated: there is the wind element that is external to oneself.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi rlung gi khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi rlung gi khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the internal wind element?

original: dge slong gang yang lus 'di la nang gi bdag nyid kyi rlung dang rlung du gyur pa zin pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong gang yang lus 'di la nang gi bdag nyid kyi rlung dang rlung du gyur pa zin pa ste /

original: de gang yang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
