original: bdag gi tshor ba btang snyoms 'di ltar yongs su dag cing byang @40a * //
analyzed: bdag gi tshor ba btang snyoms 'di ltar yongs su dag cing byang @40a * //
translated: “Since my feeling of equanimity is thus purified and cleansed,

original: bas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar gnas te /
analyzed: bas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar gnas te /
translated: I will abide in the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness, and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,🔽and cultivate the mind in the same way, and on that basis, equanimity will be present, and I will be connected with it, and attached to it, and on that basis, I will abide in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.”

original: sems de dang 'dra bar bsgoms pa dang / de la brten te btang snyoms nye bar gnas pa dang / de dang 'brel pa dang ; der zhen pa dang / de'i rgyu can gyi yod min med min skye mched la nye bar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: sems de dang 'dra bar bsgoms pa dang / de la brten te btang snyoms nye bar gnas pa dang / de dang 'brel pa dang ; der zhen pa dang / de'i rgyu can gyi yod min med min skye mched la nye bar gnas par bya'o //
translated: It is related to that, it is attached to that, and it is the cause of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: de 'di snyam du sems par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems par 'gyur te /
translated: He thinks like this:

original: gang tshor ba btang snyoms nam mkha' yas skye mched la brten te gnas pa de yang 'dus byas /
analyzed: gang tshor ba btang snyoms nam mkha' yas skye mched la brten te gnas pa de yang 'dus byas /
translated: “That equanimity of feeling that is based on and abides in the sphere of infinite space is also compounded.

original: 'dus byas gang yin pa de ni mngon par dga' bar bya ba 'am /
analyzed: 'dus byas gang yin pa de ni mngon par dga' bar bya ba 'am /
translated: Whatever is compounded is not something to be delighted in,

original: mngon par brjod pa 'am /
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa 'am /
translated: or to be expressed,🔽or to be attached to, or to be attached to and abide in.”

original: zhen pa dang / rab tu zhen cing gnas par bya ba ma yin no zhes rab tu rig nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sems 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhen pa dang / rab tu zhen cing gnas par bya ba ma yin no zhes rab tu rig nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sems 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having understood this, he becomes free from attachment to the sphere of infinite space.

original: de 'di snyam du sems par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems par 'gyur te /
translated: He thinks like this:

original: gang tshor ba btang snyoms rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du med min skye mched la brten te gnas pa de yang 'dus byas te /
analyzed: gang tshor ba btang snyoms rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du med min skye mched la brten te gnas pa de yang 'dus byas te /
translated: “He knows that the base of infinite consciousness, the base of nothingness, and the base of neither perception nor non-perception are conditioned.

original: 'dus byas gang yin pa de ni mngon par dga' bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'dus byas gang yin pa de ni mngon par dga' bar bya ba'am /
translated: He knows that whatever is conditioned is not to be delighted in,

original: mngon par brjod pa'am /
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'am /
translated: is not to be expressed,🔽is not to be clung to, and is not to be attached to.

original: zhen pa'am / rab tu zhen cing gnas par bya ba ma yin no zhes rab tu rig nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la sems 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhen pa'am / rab tu zhen cing gnas par bya ba ma yin no zhes rab tu rig nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la sems 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, his mind becomes free from attachment to the base of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: dge slong 'di ni shes rab bag yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'di ni shes rab bag yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This, bhikṣus, is called the wisdom of the bhikṣu who is heedful.

original: dge slong gang gi phyir skye mched bzhi po 'di dag las sems 'dod chags dang bral zhing grol bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: dge slong gang gi phyir skye mched bzhi po 'di dag las sems 'dod chags dang bral zhing grol bar 'gyur na /
translated: “Bhikṣus, when the mind becomes free from attachment to these four bases,

original: de sems kyi mngon par 'du byed pa dngos po 'am dngos po med par mi phyed de /
analyzed: de sems kyi mngon par 'du byed pa dngos po 'am dngos po med par mi phyed de /
translated: it does not divide things into things or non-things.

original: lus kyi mthar rig cing tshor ba na /
analyzed: lus kyi mthar rig cing tshor ba na /
translated: When he knows the end of the body and the end of feeling,

original: lus kyi mthar rig cing tshor ba'o zhes ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: lus kyi mthar rig cing tshor ba'o zhes ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is: “This is the end of the body.”

original: 'tsho ba'i mthar rig cing tshor ba na 'tsho ba'i mthar rig cing tshor ba'o zhes ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i mthar rig cing tshor ba na 'tsho ba'i mthar rig cing tshor ba'o zhes ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is: “This is the end of life.”

original: lus zhig ste shi ba'i mthar 'di thams cad rig ste /
analyzed: lus zhig ste shi ba'i mthar 'di thams cad rig ste /
translated: When the body breaks up and after death, all of this is known.

original: thams cad ma lus par 'gags pa thams cad ma lus par nub pa /
analyzed: thams cad ma lus par 'gags pa thams cad ma lus par nub pa /
translated: All without exception ceases, all without exception subsides,

original: yongs su zad cing byang bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su zad cing byang bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: all without exception is extinguished and passes away.

original: dper na ti la mar dang @40b sdong bu las sgron ma 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: dper na ti la mar dang @40b sdong bu las sgron ma 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: For example, a lamp is produced from a wick and oil.

original: de la kha cig gis dus dus su til mar gyis ma gsos shing sdong bu la nye bar ma bsdus na sgron ma'i nye bar len pa 'gags pas myur du 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la kha cig gis dus dus su til mar gyis ma gsos shing sdong bu la nye bar ma bsdus na sgron ma'i nye bar len pa 'gags pas myur du 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If someone does not from time to time add oil to it and does not replenish the wick, then the lamp’s fuel is cut off and it quickly goes out.

original: de bzhin du de lus kyi mthar rig cing tshor ba na /
analyzed: de bzhin du de lus kyi mthar rig cing tshor ba na /
translated: In the same way, when he knows the end of the body and feels it,

original: lus kyi mthar rig cing tshor ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
analyzed: lus kyi mthar rig cing tshor ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
translated: “At the end of the body, there is awareness and feeling.”

original: 'chi ba'i mthar rig cing tshor ba na 'tsho ba'i mthar rig cing tshor ba'o zhes ji lta ba bzhin du shes te /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i mthar rig cing tshor ba na 'tsho ba'i mthar rig cing tshor ba'o zhes ji lta ba bzhin du shes te /
translated: “At the end of death, there is awareness and feeling.”

original: lus zhig ste shi ba'i mthar 'di thams cad rig ste /🔽thams cad ma lus par 'gags pa ma lus par nub pa /
analyzed: lus zhig ste shi ba'i mthar 'di thams cad rig ste / thams cad ma lus par 'gags pa ma lus par nub pa /
translated: “At the end of the body’s destruction and death, all of this is awareness.”🔽“All of it without exception ceases, all of it without exception subsides,

original: yongs su zad cing yongs su byang bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su zad cing yongs su byang bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: all of it without exception comes to an end and is exhausted.”

original: de ltar mthong zhing de ltar shes na 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par 'grol bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar mthong zhing de ltar shes na 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par 'grol bar 'gyur la /
translated: “Seeing and knowing this, the mind is liberated from the defilement of desire,

original: srid pa dang ma rig pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par 'grol bar 'gyur zhing rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: srid pa dang ma rig pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par 'grol bar 'gyur zhing rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: the mind is liberated from the defilement of existence and the defilement of ignorance, and the knowledge of liberation arises:

original: bdag gi skye ba zad do //
analyzed: bdag gi skye ba zad do //
translated: ‘My births have been exhausted.

original: tshangs par spyod pa bsten to //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa bsten to //
translated: I have lived the holy life.

original: bya ba byas so //
analyzed: bya ba byas so //
translated: I have done what needed to be done.🔽I will know no other existence than this one.’

original: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One would not know anything other than this existence.🔽

original: dge slong shes rab rnams kyi nang nas mchog ni zag pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong shes rab rnams kyi nang nas mchog ni zag pa zad pa'o //
translated: The best of the monks who are wise is the one who has destroyed the defilements.

original: de'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i dge slong shes rab kyi byin gyi rlabs mchog dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i dge slong shes rab kyi byin gyi rlabs mchog dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the monk who possesses this is the one who has the best of the blessings of wisdom.

original: de'i rnam par grol ba bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs mchog dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam par grol ba bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs mchog dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: His liberation is the best of the blessings of truth.

original: dge slong brdzun pa'i mchog ni brdzun pa slu ba'i chos so //🔽dge slong bden pa rnams kyi mchog ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong brdzun pa'i mchog ni brdzun pa slu ba'i chos so // dge slong bden pa rnams kyi mchog ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The best of the monks who are liars is the one who has the quality of lying and deceiving.

original: ji lta ba nyid do //
analyzed: ji lta ba nyid do //
translated: The best of the monks who are truthful is the one who is just as he is.

original: de'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i dge slong bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs mchog dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i dge slong bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs mchog dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the monk who possesses this is the one who has the best of the blessings of truth.

original: gang 'di nye bar len pa ni sngon gyi mi mkhas shing mi shes pa las nye bar len par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang 'di nye bar len pa ni sngon gyi mi mkhas shing mi shes pa las nye bar len par 'gyur te /
translated: This appropriation is appropriated by the unwise and unknowing from the past.

original: de med na de'i dus na mi sdug pa dang yid du mi 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med na de'i dus na mi sdug pa dang yid du mi 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it does not exist, at that time it becomes ugly and undesirable.

original: dge slong stong pa rnams kyi nang nas mchog ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong stong pa rnams kyi nang nas mchog ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The best of the monks who are empty is the one who is just as he is.

original: nye bar len pa thams cad las nges par 'byung ba /
analyzed: nye bar len pa thams cad las nges par 'byung ba /
translated: It is the definite emergence from all appropriating aggregates,

original: srid pa zad pa /
analyzed: srid pa zad pa /
translated: the exhaustion of existence,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: the absence of desire,

original: 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
translated: the cessation, nirvāṇa.

original: de'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i dge slong gtong ba'i byin gyi rlabs mchog dang ldan par @41a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i dge slong gtong ba'i byin gyi rlabs mchog dang ldan par @41a * //
translated: Therefore, the monk who possesses that is said to be endowed with the supreme blessing of generosity.

original: 'gyur ro // dge slong 'dod chags nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las sems rnam par ma grol ba /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // dge slong 'dod chags nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las sems rnam par ma grol ba /
translated: “Monks, those whose minds are not liberated from the affliction of desire,

original: zhe sdang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / gti mug nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las sems rnam par ma grol ba 'di dag dge slong 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug ma lus par spangs nas nges par 'byung ba bral ba zad pa 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa rab tu zhi ba nub pa nye
analyzed: zhe sdang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / gti mug nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las sems rnam par ma grol ba 'di dag dge slong 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug ma lus par spangs nas nges par 'byung ba bral ba zad pa 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa rab tu zhi ba nub pa nye
translated: from the affliction of hatred, and from the affliction of delusion, are said to be monks who have not abandoned desire, hatred, and delusion in their entirety, who have not emerged, who have not been freed, who have not exhausted, who have not separated from desire, who have not ceased, who have not fully pacified, who have not disappeared, who have not

original: bar zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bar zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: subsided.

original: dge slong mchog tu nye bar zhi ba ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: dge slong mchog tu nye bar zhi ba ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: “Monks, these are the ones who are supremely pacified:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug ma lus par spangs pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug ma lus par spangs pa /
translated: It is the complete abandonment of desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: nges par 'byung ba /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba /
translated: It is the definite emergence.

original: bral ba zad pa /
analyzed: bral ba zad pa /
translated: It is the separation, the exhaustion,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa rab tu zhi ba nub pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa rab tu zhi ba nub pa ste /
translated: the dispassion, the cessation, the pacification, the disappearance of desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: de'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i dge slong ni nye bar zhi ba mchog gi byin gyi rlabs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //🔽dge slong bdag ces bya ba 'di ni mi brtan pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i dge slong ni nye bar zhi ba mchog gi byin gyi rlabs dang ldan par 'gyur ro // dge slong bdag ces bya ba 'di ni mi brtan pa /
translated: Therefore, the monk who possesses this is said to be endowed with the supreme blessing of peace.🔽“The monk” is unstable.

original: nga'i bdag ces bya ba 'di ni mi brtan pa /🔽'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni mi brtan pa /
analyzed: nga'i bdag ces bya ba 'di ni mi brtan pa / 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni mi brtan pa /
translated: “I” is unstable.🔽“Will arise” is unstable.

original: 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni mi brtan pa /🔽gzugs 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni mi brtan pa /
analyzed: 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni mi brtan pa / gzugs 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni mi brtan pa /
translated: “Will not arise” is unstable.🔽“Form will arise” is unstable.

original: gzugs med par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni mi brtan pa /🔽'du shes 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni mi brtan pa /
analyzed: gzugs med par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni mi brtan pa / 'du shes 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni mi brtan pa /
translated: “Form will not arise” is unstable.🔽“Perception will arise” is unstable.

original: 'du shes 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni mi brtan pa /
analyzed: 'du shes 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni mi brtan pa /
translated: “Perception will not arise” is unstable.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni mi brtan pa /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni mi brtan pa /
translated: “The occurrence of neither perception nor non-perception” is unstable.

original: dge slong mi brtan pa ni nad /
analyzed: dge slong mi brtan pa ni nad /
translated: Unstable monks are sick.

original: mi brtan pa ni 'bras /
analyzed: mi brtan pa ni 'bras /
translated: Unstable is the fruit.

original: mi brtan pa ni brug rngu /
analyzed: mi brtan pa ni brug rngu /
translated: Unstable is the abscess.🔽Unstable is the root of suffering.

original: mi brtan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba yin no zhes rnam par shes nas dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pas brtan pa'i sems kyis phal cher gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: mi brtan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba yin no zhes rnam par shes nas dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pas brtan pa'i sems kyis phal cher gnas par bya'o //
translated: Having understood this, with mindfulness and vigilance, one should mostly abide with a stable mind.

original: ji ltar mi brtan pa de bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / spros pa dang / 'dus byas yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mi brtan pa de bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / spros pa dang / 'dus byas yin no //
translated: Just as it is unstable, so it is with thorough knowledge, conceptual elaboration, and the conditioned.

original: dge slong bdag ces bya ba 'di ni sred par gyur pa ;🔽nga'i bdag ces bya ba 'di ni sred par gyur pa /
analyzed: dge slong bdag ces bya ba 'di ni sred par gyur pa ; nga'i bdag ces bya ba 'di ni sred par gyur pa /
translated: “Monks, this ‘self’ is a form of craving.🔽‘My self’ is a form of craving.

original: bdag 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni sred par gyur pa /
analyzed: bdag 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni sred par gyur pa /
translated: ‘The self will arise’ is a form of craving.

original: bdag 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni sred par gyur pa /
analyzed: bdag 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni sred par gyur pa /
translated: ‘The self will not arise’ is a form of craving.

original: gzugs 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni sred par gyur pa /
analyzed: gzugs 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni sred par gyur pa /
translated: ‘Form will arise’ is a form of craving.

original: gzugs med par 'byung bar @41b 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni sred par gyur pa /
analyzed: gzugs med par 'byung bar @41b 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni sred par gyur pa /
translated: ‘I will be formless’ is a form of craving.

original: 'du shes 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni sred par gyur pa /🔽'du shes 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni sred par gyur pa /
analyzed: 'du shes 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni sred par gyur pa / 'du shes 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni sred par gyur pa /
translated: ‘I will have perception’ is a form of craving.🔽‘I will have no perception’ is a form of craving.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni sred par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni sred par gyur pa ste /
translated: ‘I will have neither perception nor non-perception’ is a form of craving.

original: dge slong sred pa ni nad /🔽sred pa ni 'bras /
analyzed: dge slong sred pa ni nad / sred pa ni 'bras /
translated: Monks, craving is a disease,🔽craving is a tumor,

original: sred pa ni zung rngu /
analyzed: sred pa ni zung rngu /
translated: craving is an arrow,🔽craving is the root of suffering.

original: sred pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba yin no zhes rnam par shes nas dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pas sred pa dang bral ba'i sems kyis phal cher gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: sred pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba yin no zhes rnam par shes nas dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pas sred pa dang bral ba'i sems kyis phal cher gnas par bya'o //
translated: Having understood this, you should, with a mind free from craving, abide mostly in mindfulness and awareness.

original: dge slong mi brtan pa dang / rab tu shes pa dang / spros pa dang / 'dus byas dang / sred par gyur pa 'di dag ma lus par spangs na nges par 'byung ba dang bral ba dang / zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: dge slong mi brtan pa dang / rab tu shes pa dang / spros pa dang / 'dus byas dang / sred par gyur pa 'di dag ma lus par spangs na nges par 'byung ba dang bral ba dang / zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
translated: “Monks, when the unstable, the very learned, the elaborate, the conditioned, and craving are all completely abandoned, this is called ‘definite emergence,’ ‘freedom,’ ‘exhaustion,’ ‘freedom from attachment,’

original: 'gog pa dang / rab tu zhi ba dang / nub pa dang / nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o//
analyzed: 'gog pa dang / rab tu zhi ba dang / nub pa dang / nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o//
translated: ‘cessation,’ ‘complete peace,’ ‘disappearance,’ and ‘complete pacification.’

original: dge slong thub pa zhes bya ba ni gang la skye ba med pa dang / rga ba med pa dang / 'chi ba med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / chags pa med pa dang / yongs su gdung ba med pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong thub pa zhes bya ba ni gang la skye ba med pa dang / rga ba med pa dang / 'chi ba med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / chags pa med pa dang / yongs su gdung ba med pa ste /
translated: “Monks, one who is called ‘a sage’ is one who has no birth, no aging, no death, no anger, no attachment, and no distress.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di nyid rgyu dang / rkyen med pas skye ba med pa'o //🔽ma skyes pa na gang las rga bar 'gyur zhing /🔽ma rgas na gang las 'chi bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di nyid rgyu dang / rkyen med pas skye ba med pa'o // ma skyes pa na gang las rga bar 'gyur zhing / ma rgas na gang las 'chi bar 'gyur la /
translated: Because this is without cause and condition, there is no birth.🔽If there is no birth, then from what would aging come?🔽If there is no aging, then from what would death come?

original: 'chi ba med na gang las zhe sdang bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'chi ba med na gang las zhe sdang bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: If there is no death, then from what would anger come?

original: zhe sdang med na gang las chags par 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhe sdang med na gang las chags par 'gyur la /
translated: If there is no anger, from what would attachment arise?🔽If there is no old age, from what would suffering arise?

original: rgas pa med na gang las yongs su gdung bar 'gyur zhes bdag gi skye ba zad do //
analyzed: rgas pa med na gang las yongs su gdung bar 'gyur zhes bdag gi skye ba zad do //
translated: I have exhausted my births.

original: tshangs par spyod pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa bstan to //
translated: I have taught the pure life.

original: bya ba byas so //
analyzed: bya ba byas so //
translated: I have done what needed to be done.

original: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes de nyid so sor rang gi rig pa'i shes rab kyis rab tu shes so //
analyzed: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes de nyid so sor rang gi rig pa'i shes rab kyis rab tu shes so //
translated: I will know no other life than this.

original: dge slong khams drug rab tu rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs thog mar dge ba bar du dge ba tha mar dge ba don bzang po tshig 'bru bzang po /
analyzed: dge slong khams drug rab tu rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs thog mar dge ba bar du dge ba tha mar dge ba don bzang po tshig 'bru bzang po /
translated: Monks, I will explain the Dharma discourse called the Analysis of the Six Elements, which is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, which has excellent meaning, excellent words, and excellent meaning and words,

original: ma 'dres pa yongs su rdzogs pa /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa yongs su rdzogs pa /
translated: which is unadulterated, complete,

original: yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa /
translated: pure,

original: yongs su byang ba /
analyzed: yongs su byang ba /
translated: and refined,🔽and which illuminates the pure life.

original: tshangs par spyod pa gsal bar byed pa'i chos bshad par bya'o zhes khams rab tu dbye ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs ngas ji skad du bstan pa de rgyas par rab tu bshad do //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa gsal bar byed pa'i chos bshad par bya'o zhes khams rab tu dbye ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs ngas ji skad du bstan pa de rgyas par rab tu bshad do //
translated: Monks, I will explain in detail the Dharma discourse on the analysis of the elements just as I have taught it.

original: chos kyi rnam @42a * //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam @42a * //
translated: The Dharma discourse

original: grangs 'di bstan pa na tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri chos rnams la chos kyi mig rngul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag pa skyes so //
analyzed: grangs 'di bstan pa na tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri chos rnams la chos kyi mig rngul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag pa skyes so //
translated: When this was taught, the Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra’s eye of Dharma became free of dust and stainless.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa phur skar sa ri chos mthong ba dang / chos thob pa dang / chos rig pa dang / chos khong du chud nas the tshom las brgal zhing /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa phur skar sa ri chos mthong ba dang / chos thob pa dang / chos rig pa dang / chos khong du chud nas the tshom las brgal zhing /
translated: Then the Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, having seen the Dharma, attained the Dharma, known the Dharma,

original: so ma nyi las rgal te /🔽gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro bar bya ba ma yin pa'i bstan pa'i chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa thob nas stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar te /
analyzed: so ma nyi las rgal te / gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro bar bya ba ma yin pa'i bstan pa'i chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa thob nas stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar te /
translated: having plunged through the darkness of ignorance,🔽having gained confidence in the teachings, not dependent on others for the teachings,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la gtugs te 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la gtugs te 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: he rose from his seat, drew down the right shoulder of his upper robe, bowed to the Blessed One with palms together, and said to the Blessed One,🔽“Blessed One, I wish to go forth in the wellproclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byis pa dang / ji ltar rmongs pa dang / ji ltar mi gsal ba dang / ji ltar mi mkhas pa bdag gis ston pa la tshe dang ldan pa zhes yang dag par brjod pa ni sdig pa bgyis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byis pa dang / ji ltar rmongs pa dang / ji ltar mi gsal ba dang / ji ltar mi mkhas pa bdag gis ston pa la tshe dang ldan pa zhes yang dag par brjod pa ni sdig pa bgyis so //
translated: Blessed One, how foolish, how confused, how unclear, how unskilled I was to address the Teacher as ‘venerable one.’ I have done wrong.

original: bde bar gshegs pa sdig pa bgyis so //🔽btsun pa de la sdig par 'tshal zhing /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa sdig pa bgyis so // btsun pa de la sdig par 'tshal zhing /
translated: Sugata, I have done wrong.🔽Reverend, I acknowledge my wrongdoing as wrongdoing,

original: sdig par khums la sdig pa la sdig par 'dzin pas thugs brtse bar mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: sdig par khums la sdig pa la sdig par 'dzin pas thugs brtse bar mdzad du gsol /
translated: and confess it as a wrongdoing. Please have compassion.

original: dge slong khyod bden te /
analyzed: dge slong khyod bden te /
translated: “Monk, you are right.

original: ji ltar byis pa dang / ji ltar rmongs pa dang / ji ltar mi gsal ba dang / ji ltar mi mkhas pas ston pa la tshe dang ldan pa zhes brjod pa ni sdig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa dang / ji ltar rmongs pa dang / ji ltar mi gsal ba dang / ji ltar mi mkhas pas ston pa la tshe dang ldan pa zhes brjod pa ni sdig par 'gyur ro //
translated: How foolish, how confused, how unclear, how unskilled you were to address the Teacher as ‘venerable one.’ It is wrong.🔽Monk, you should acknowledge your wrongdoing as wrongdoing,

original: dge slong gang gi phyir sdig par shes shing sdig par mthong ba dang / sdig pa bshags shing phyis mi byed pa'i sdom pa blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gang gi phyir sdig par shes shing sdig par mthong ba dang / sdig pa bshags shing phyis mi byed pa'i sdom pa blang bar bya'o //
translated: and confess it as a wrongdoing. You should take the vow not to commit it again.”

original: dge ba'i chos rnams 'phel bar 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams 'phel bar 'dod par bya'o //
translated: You should wish for the increase of wholesome qualities.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dge slong gang 'ga' zhig sdig par shes shing sdig par mthong la sdig pa bshags shing phyis mi byed pa'i sdom pa 'dzin na dge ba'i chos rnams mi nyams shing 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gang 'ga' zhig sdig par shes shing sdig par mthong la sdig pa bshags shing phyis mi byed pa'i sdom pa 'dzin na dge ba'i chos rnams mi nyams shing 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk knows that something is unwholesome, sees that it is unwholesome, confesses that it is unwholesome, and later refrains from it, then wholesome qualities will not decline but will increase.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri la chos kyi gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /🔽yang dag par brjod cing /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri la chos kyi gtam gyis yang dag par bstan / yang dag par brjod cing /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having taught the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra the Dharma with its benefits,🔽having gladdened him,

original: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad nas gdan las bzhengs te gshegs so //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad nas gdan las bzhengs te gshegs so //
translated: arose from his seat and departed.

original: tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri yang bcom ldan 'das kyi phyi nas song ngo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri yang bcom ldan 'das kyi phyi nas song ngo //
translated: The venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra also followed behind the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te /
translated: He bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet,

original: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas te /
translated: circumambulated the Blessed One three times,

original: bcom ldan 'das @42b kyi zhabs drung nas log ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @42b kyi zhabs drung nas log ste /
translated: and returned from the presence of the Blessed One.

original: ring po ma lon par ba be'u gzhon nu ma yod pa zhig gis 'tsho ba dang phral bar gyur to //
analyzed: ring po ma lon par ba be'u gzhon nu ma yod pa zhig gis 'tsho ba dang phral bar gyur to //
translated: Before long, a young cow killed him.

original: de 'chi ba'i dus na dbang po rnams rab tu gsal bar gyur /
analyzed: de 'chi ba'i dus na dbang po rnams rab tu gsal bar gyur /
translated: When he was dying, his faculties became very clear.

original: bzhin yongs su dag par gyur /
analyzed: bzhin yongs su dag par gyur /
translated: His face became completely pure.

original: pags pa'i mdog dkar bar gyur to //
analyzed: pags pa'i mdog dkar bar gyur to //
translated: His skin became white.

original: de nas nyin zhag de nyid kyi snga dro dge slong rab tu mang po chos gos bgos khar gsil thogs te rgyal po'i khabs tu bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na /
analyzed: de nas nyin zhag de nyid kyi snga dro dge slong rab tu mang po chos gos bgos khar gsil thogs te rgyal po'i khabs tu bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na /
translated: Then, in the morning of that very day, many monks put on their Dharma robes, took their bowls and robes, and entered Rājagṛha for alms.

original: rgyal po'i khab tu bsod snyoms la rgyu ba'i dge slong mang po de dag gis 'di skad du thos te /
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab tu bsod snyoms la rgyu ba'i dge slong mang po de dag gis 'di skad du thos te /
translated: The many monks who were wandering for alms in Rājagṛha heard this:

original: bcom ldan 'das rdza mkhan bharga'i khang pa na tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri khams drug rab tu rnam par dbye ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs kyis btul cing bkod la bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs drung nas log ste ring po ma lon par pa be'u gzhon
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdza mkhan bharga'i khang pa na tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri khams drug rab tu rnam par dbye ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs kyis btul cing bkod la bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs drung nas log ste ring po ma lon par pa be'u gzhon
translated: “The Blessed One, in the potter Bhargava’s house, has tamed and arranged the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra with the Dharma discourse of the thorough differentiation of the six elements. Not long after the Blessed One’s feet were turned away, a young cow

original: nu 'brangs pa zhig gis 'tsho ba dang phral bar gyur te /
analyzed: nu 'brangs pa zhig gis 'tsho ba dang phral bar gyur te /
translated: He was separated from his wife and children.

original: de 'chi ba'i dus na dbang po rnams yongs su gsal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de 'chi ba'i dus na dbang po rnams yongs su gsal bar 'gyur /
translated: When he was dying, his faculties became clear.

original: bzhin gyi mdog yongs su dag par 'gyur /
analyzed: bzhin gyi mdog yongs su dag par 'gyur /
translated: The color of his face became pure.🔽His skin became completely white.”

original: pags pa yongs su dkar bar gyur zhes rgyal po'i khabs kyi bsod snyoms pa rnams kyis thos te /🔽zas kyi bya ba byas nas /
analyzed: pags pa yongs su dkar bar gyur zhes rgyal po'i khabs kyi bsod snyoms pa rnams kyis thos te / zas kyi bya ba byas nas /
translated: The alms-seekers of Rājagṛha heard this,

original: de 'og tu lhung bzed gyur ste /🔽lhung bzed dang / chos gos rnams phyogs gcig tu bzhag nas rkang pa bkrus te bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
analyzed: de 'og tu lhung bzed gyur ste / lhung bzed dang / chos gos rnams phyogs gcig tu bzhag nas rkang pa bkrus te bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
translated: and after they had finished their meal,🔽they put their bowls away,🔽and after washing their feet, they went to where the Blessed One was.

original: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te /🔽phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te / phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: When they arrived, they bowed their heads at the Blessed One’s feet,🔽and then they sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas /
translated: When they were sitting to one side,

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: they said this to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa 'di na bdag cag snga dro chos gos bgos lhung bzed thogs te rgyal po'i khab tu bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na /
analyzed: btsun pa 'di na bdag cag snga dro chos gos bgos lhung bzed thogs te rgyal po'i khab tu bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na /
translated: “Noble one, this morning we put on our robes, took our bowls, and entered Rājagṛha for alms.

original: btsun pa bdag cag dge slong mang po bsod snyoms la zhugs pa de dag gis 'di skad thos te /
analyzed: btsun pa bdag cag dge slong mang po bsod snyoms la zhugs pa de dag gis 'di skad thos te /
translated: Noble one, we monks who went for alms heard this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri bcom ldan 'das rdzas mkhan bharga'i khang pa na tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri khams drug rab tu rnam par dbye ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs kyis brtul cing bkod pa bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs drung nas log ste
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri bcom ldan 'das rdzas mkhan bharga'i khang pa na tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri khams drug rab tu rnam par dbye ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs kyis brtul cing bkod pa bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs drung nas log ste
translated: ‘The Blessed One is staying in the house of the smith Bharadvāja, where the Blessed One is engaged in the Dharma discourse on the thorough differentiation of the six elements with the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra.

original: / ring po ma lon par ba be'u gzhon nu 'brangs ba zhig gis 'tsho ba dang @43a * //
analyzed: / ring po ma lon par ba be'u gzhon nu 'brangs ba zhig gis 'tsho ba dang @43a * //
translated: Not long after the Blessed One left, a young calf followed him.

original: phral bar gyur te /
analyzed: phral bar gyur te /
translated: That calf was separated from its life.

original: de 'chi ba'i dus na dbang po rnams yongs su gsal bar gyur /
analyzed: de 'chi ba'i dus na dbang po rnams yongs su gsal bar gyur /
translated: At the time of its death, its faculties became clear,

original: bzhin yongs su dag par gyur /
analyzed: bzhin yongs su dag par gyur /
translated: its face became pure,

original: pags pa'i mdog yongs su dkar bar gyur /
analyzed: pags pa'i mdog yongs su dkar bar gyur /
translated: and the color of its skin became white.

original: ces thos so //
analyzed: ces thos so //
translated: We heard this.”

original: btsun pa de'i 'gro ba ni ci zhig yin /
analyzed: btsun pa de'i 'gro ba ni ci zhig yin /
translated: What is the destiny of that monk?

original: 'jig rten pha rol ni ci zhig yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol ni ci zhig yin /
translated: What is the next world?

original: dge slong dag rigs kyi bu de'i skye ba ni 'gag pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag rigs kyi bu de'i skye ba ni 'gag pa ste /
translated: Monks, the birth of that noble son has ceased.

original: chos rnams la chos rnams rjes su rab tu shes te /
analyzed: chos rnams la chos rnams rjes su rab tu shes te /
translated: He has fully understood phenomena in phenomena.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: chos kyi dbang du byas nas nga la gnod par 'gyur ba ma byas te /🔽dge slong dag rigs kyi bu de yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i lus la lus kyi mchod pa gyis shig / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri lung bstan nas dge slong dag bcom ldan 'das la mngon par dga' zhing
analyzed: chos kyi dbang du byas nas nga la gnod par 'gyur ba ma byas te / dge slong dag rigs kyi bu de yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i lus la lus kyi mchod pa gyis shig / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa phu skar sa ri lung bstan nas dge slong dag bcom ldan 'das la mngon par dga' zhing
translated: He has not harmed me by taking phenomena as a basis.🔽Monks, make physical offerings to the body of that noble son who has passed into parinirvāṇa.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par rjes su yi rang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par rjes su yi rang ngo //
translated: Then, after the Fortunate One had given the elder Pukkusa the prediction, the monks rejoiced in and praised what the Fortunate One had said.

original: 'du shes dang sems pa'i chos de dag ni sems las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma chos sbyin gyi mdo sngar bris pa bzhin blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes dang sems pa'i chos de dag ni sems las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma chos sbyin gyi mdo sngar bris pa bzhin blta bar bya'o //
translated: The phenomena of perception and intention are mental factors. This should be understood as it was written earlier in the Sūtra of the Nun Dhammadinnā.

original: yang nyan thos kyi rnam par bshad pa las sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa bcu gsum pa'i mdo las tshe dang ldan pa bde byed kyi ji skad bstan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: yang nyan thos kyi rnam par bshad pa las sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa bcu gsum pa'i mdo las tshe dang ldan pa bde byed kyi ji skad bstan pa bzhin te /
translated: Again, the sutra of the thirteen verses of the summary in the explanation of the sravakas is like what is taught by the Venerable Subhuti.

original: gzhan yang mdo de dang de las 'don pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo de dang de las 'don pa lta bu'o //
translated: And it is like what is recited in that sutra and others.

original: sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mdo sde mang po las 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mdo sde mang po las 'byung ste /
translated: Because a mind with attachment and so on arises, it appears in many sutras.

original: ci lta re zhig rnam grangs rnam par bshad pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang po'i mdo las /
analyzed: ci lta re zhig rnam grangs rnam par bshad pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang po'i mdo las /
translated: How is it? For example, in the second verse of the summary of the categories, in the sutra of the first foundation of mindfulness, it says:

original: ji ltar na dge slong sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dge slong sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas she na /
translated: How does a monk abide observing the mind in the mind?

original: dge slong 'di la sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa las sems 'dod chags dang bcas so zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dge slong 'di la sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa las sems 'dod chags dang bcas so zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: A monk knows exactly as it is that the mind with attachment is a mind with attachment.

original: sems 'dod chags dang bral ba la sems 'dod chags dang bral lo zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //🔽zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / bsdus pa dang rnam par @43b g-yengs pa dang / zhum pa dang / rab tu bsdus pa dang / mtho ba dang /
analyzed: sems 'dod chags dang bral ba la sems 'dod chags dang bral lo zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so // zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / bsdus pa dang rnam par @43b g-yengs pa dang / zhum pa dang / rab tu bsdus pa dang / mtho ba dang /
translated: He knows as it really is: ‘The mind that is free from passion is free from passion.’

original: dma' ba dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nye bar ma zhi ba dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / bsgoms pa dang / ma bsgoms pa dang / sems rnam par grol ba dang / sems rnam par ma grol ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dma' ba dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nye bar ma zhi ba dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / bsgoms pa dang / ma bsgoms pa dang / sems rnam par grol ba dang / sems rnam par ma grol ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is: ‘The mind that is associated with aversion is associated with aversion, the mind that is free from aversion is free from aversion. The mind that is associated with confusion is associated with confusion, the mind that is free from confusion is free from confusion. The mind that is contracted is contracted, the mind that is distracted is distracted. The mind that is slack is slack, the mind that is excited is excited.🔽The mind that is not fully stilled is not fully stilled, the mind that is fully stilled is fully stilled. The mind that is not concentrated is not concentrated, the mind that is concentrated is concentrated. The mind that is not liberated is not liberated, the mind that is liberated is liberated.’

original: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba la sems shin tu rnam par grol ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba la sems shin tu rnam par grol ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is: ‘The mind that is completely liberated is completely liberated.’

original: nang gi sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //🔽phyi'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
analyzed: nang gi sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so // phyi'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
translated: He dwells watching the mind internally, or he dwells watching the mind externally, or he dwells watching the mind internally and externally.🔽He dwells watching the arising of the mind, or he dwells watching the passing away of the mind, or he dwells watching the arising and passing away of the mind.

original: nang dang phyi'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //🔽kun 'byung ba'i chos can la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //🔽'jig pa'i chos can la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so // kun 'byung ba'i chos can la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so // 'jig pa'i chos can la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
translated: He dwells watching the mind internally, or he dwells watching the mind externally, or he dwells watching the mind internally and externally.

original: kun 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can gyi sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can gyi sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
translated: He dwells watching the arising of the mind, or he dwells watching the passing away of the mind, or he dwells watching the arising and passing away of the mind.🔽Or his mindfulness is established with the thought, “The mind exists,” to the extent necessary just for knowledge and mindfulness, and he dwells detached, and clings to nothing in the world.🔽Thus, monks, a monk dwells watching the mind in the mind.

original: sems so zhes rjes su dran pa dang dran pa nye bar gzhag par gyur pa na rnam par shes pa tsam dang mthong ba tsam dang / rab tu dran pa tsam gyi bar du rten cing gnas te /🔽'jig rten cung zad nye bar mi len te /
analyzed: sems so zhes rjes su dran pa dang dran pa nye bar gzhag par gyur pa na rnam par shes pa tsam dang mthong ba tsam dang / rab tu dran pa tsam gyi bar du rten cing gnas te / 'jig rten cung zad nye bar mi len te /
translated: “Again, monks, a monk dwells watching mental phenomena in mental phenomena, ardent, clearly comprehending, and mindful, having removed covetousness and displeasure in regard to the world.🔽And how, monks, does a monk dwell watching mental phenomena in mental phenomena?

original: 'di ltar dge slong sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
translated: Here, monks, a monk, when lust is present, knows “there is lust in me”; or, when lust is not present, he knows “there is no lust in me.”🔽He knows how the arising of the non-arisen lust comes to be; he knows how the abandoning of the arisen lust comes to be; and he knows how the non-arising in the future of the abandoned lust comes to be.🔽When hatred is present, he knows “there is hatred in me”; or, when hatred is not present, he knows “there is no hatred in me.”🔽He knows how the arising of the non-arisen hatred comes to be; he knows how the abandoning of the arisen hatred comes to be; and he knows how the non-arising in the future of the abandoned hatred comes to be.🔽When delusion is present, he knows “there is delusion in me”; or, when delusion is not present, he knows “there is no delusion in me.”🔽He knows how the arising of the non-arisen delusion comes to be; he knows how the abandoning of the arisen delusion comes to be; and he knows how the non-arising in the future of the abandoned delusion comes to be.

original: reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni sngon gyi las yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni sngon gyi las yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: These six sense bases are to be known as former karma.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting was in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag khyed cag gis phung po ma yin zhing gzhan gyi yang ma yin gyi reg pa'i skye mched drug ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed cag gis phung po ma yin zhing gzhan gyi yang ma yin gyi reg pa'i skye mched drug ste /
translated: “Monks, you should know that these six sense bases are not a self or what belongs to a self.

original: dge slong reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni sngon gyi las mngon par 'dus byas pa /
analyzed: dge slong reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni sngon gyi las mngon par 'dus byas pa /
translated: Monks, these six sense bases are former karma that has been accumulated and is to be felt.

original: mngon par dga' ba sngon gyi las nyid du rig par bya'o zhes nga smra'o //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba sngon gyi las nyid du rig par bya'o zhes nga smra'o //
translated: Monks, I say that these six sense bases are to be known as former karma that has been accumulated and is to be felt.

original: rig pa'i skye mched drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: rig pa'i skye mched drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six sense bases?

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i skye mched dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i skye mched do //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i skye mched dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i skye mched do //
translated: They are the sense base of eye contact, the sense base of ear contact, the sense base of nose contact, the sense base of tongue contact, the sense base of body contact, and the sense base of thought contact.

original: dge slong dag de la 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shin tu legs par tshul bzhin dpyod par byed do //
analyzed: dge slong dag de la 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shin tu legs par tshul bzhin dpyod par byed do //
translated: Monks, the noble disciple who has learning and who thoroughly and properly investigates dependent origination thinks as follows:

original: 'di lta ste 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
translated: It is like this: because this exists, that comes to be.

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ste 'di lta ste 'di yod pas rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug 'byung la /🔽reg @44a * //
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ste 'di lta ste 'di yod pas rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug 'byung la / reg @44a * //
translated: Because this has arisen, that arises. It is like this: because there is ignorance, the six sense-spheres come to be.🔽The six sense-spheres,

original: pa'i tshogs drug dang / tshor ba'i tshogs drug dang / sred pa'i tshogs drug go //
analyzed: pa'i tshogs drug dang / tshor ba'i tshogs drug dang / sred pa'i tshogs drug go //
translated: the six sense-contacts, the six feelings, and the six cravings.🔽It is like this: because there is birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain,

original: 'di lta ste 'di yod pas skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa rnams 'byung zhing /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'di yod pas skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa rnams 'byung zhing /
translated: and distress come to be.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'di 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur te /🔽dge slong 'di ltar 'jig rten ni rgyu dang bcas shing rkyen dang bcas pa las rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'di 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur te / dge slong 'di ltar 'jig rten ni rgyu dang bcas shing rkyen dang bcas pa las rab tu byung ste /
translated: Thus, this entire mass of suffering comes to be.🔽Monks, in this way the world arises from causes.

original: de ltar na 'jig rten ni rgyu dang bcas pa las rab tu byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten ni rgyu dang bcas pa las rab tu byung ngo //
translated: Thus, the world arises from causes.

original: dge slong dag 'jig rten ni rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas pa las rab tu 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'jig rten ni rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas pa las rab tu 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Monks, the world is extinguished through causes and conditions.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas pa las rab tu 'gag par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas pa las rab tu 'gag par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is the world extinguished through causes and conditions?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
translated: It is like this:🔽When this exists, that comes to be;

original: 'di 'gags pas 'di 'gag ste /
analyzed: 'di 'gags pas 'di 'gag ste /
translated: with the arising of this, that arises.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po 'di med pas reg pa'i tshogs drug dang / tshor ba'i tshogs drug dang / sred pa'i tshogs drug mi 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po 'di med pas reg pa'i tshogs drug dang / tshor ba'i tshogs drug dang / sred pa'i tshogs drug mi 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: When the six collections of consciousness do not exist, the six collections of contact and the six collections of feeling and the six collections of craving do not come to be.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: 'di med pas skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di med pas skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: When this does not exist, birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, anxiety, and distress do not come to be.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, this great mass of pure suffering ceases.

original: dge slong dag gang gi phyir 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'jig rten 'byung ba dang bcas pa 'jig rten 'gog pa dang bcas pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi shes rab kyis rab tu mthong bar gyur cing rab tu rig pa dang🔽/ rab tu yid la byed pa dang / rab tu bsten pa dang / yang dag par rab tu rig pa zhes brjod do //
